MsgJp:
どうしたらいいのかしら
こんなはずじゃなかったわ
幸せってどうやって見つけるものだったかしら
MsgEn:
What should I do? This isn't how it was supposed
to be.
I wonder how you're supposed to find happiness.

MsgJp:
覚者様は僕たちのこと
いつまで助けてくれるの――？
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, how long will you continue to help
us?

MsgJp:
もうずっと体の具合がよくないんだ
ううん、戦争が始まる前からだけどね
MsgEn:
My physical condition hasn't been good for a
while now.
Not since before the war started, indeed.

MsgJp:
きっとこれから大変だよね
村を作り直すんだもん
僕の居場所はあるのかな
MsgEn:
I'm sure it's going to be tough from now on,
since we have to rebuild the village.
I wonder if there's a place for me.

MsgJp:
魔軍から生きて解放されたし
兵士さんもたくさん来てくれたけど――
MsgEn:
I was released from the demon army, and many
soldiers came to help, but...

MsgEn: Hello, temporary

MsgEn: Small talk 1, temporary

MsgJp: はい、何か
MsgEn: Aye, what is it?

MsgJp:
地下に隠れ潜んでいても
情報収集は怠っておりません
この地区のことであれば、何なりと
MsgEn:
Even while hiding underground, I haven't
neglected to gather information.
If it's about this area, feel free to ask
anything.

MsgJp:
新たな情報でしょうか、それとも
何かお困りのことでも――？
MsgEn:
Is there any new information, or is there
something troubling you?

MsgJp:
メガドシスにおいて
アッカー家と覚者様をお支えすることが
第一の使命と考えております
MsgEn:
In Megado, our first and foremost mission is to
support the Acre family and the esteemed Arisen.

MsgJp:
まったく頭が痛くなることばかりですね
――いえ、頭痛持ちというわけでは
ありませんが
MsgEn:
Seems like nothing but headaches, doesn't it?
--Well, I don't mean I suffer from headaches, but
you get the idea.

MsgJp:
残念ながら、この状況です
十分な情報を提供できないのは
私も遺憾に思っています
MsgEn:
Unfortunately, this is the current situation.
Regretfully, I've naught else to provide.

MsgJp:
やるべきことをやるのみ
兵士とはそういったものです
MsgEn:
We do what we have to do.
That's what being a soldier is all about.

MsgJp:
メガドを取り戻せたのは僥倖です
――はやく王宮を奪還したいものです
私たちは、本来あそこにいるべきなのです
MsgEn:
It is a stroke of luck that we were able to
reclaim Megado.
I hope we can retake the Royal Palace soon.
That's where we should be, where we truly belong.

MsgJp:
王族を、王都をお守りするのが
我らメガド王宮近衛隊の使命――
一度その名が折れた悔しさを糧に
明日を切り開くのみです
MsgEn:
Our mission as the Megado Royal Guard is to
protect the Royal Family and the capital.
We must use the regret of our past failures as
fuel to carve out a path towards a brighter
future.

MsgJp:
王子を守りぬかねばなりません
何としても――
MsgEn:
We must protect the prince.
At all costs--

MsgJp:
覚者様のお噂、この北の地まで響いてまいりました
王子を――ネド王子を救い出してくださったとのこと
我々近衛隊一同、心よりの感謝を――
MsgEn:
Word has reached us, esteemed Arisen, that you
have come to this northern land and rescued Prince
Nedo.
The entirety of the Royal Guard expresses our
heartfelt gratitude for your noble deed.

MsgJp:
何かお力となりたいのですが、負傷者が多く
この場を動くことが叶わないのです
MsgEn:
I would like to be of assistance, but there are
many injured individuals, and I am unable to leave
this location.

MsgJp:
くっ――
倉庫から日用品の類をかき集めてまいります
せめてもの支給品とさせていただきたく――
MsgEn:
Hngh...
I shall gather some supplies from the warehouse
and provide them as at least some form of
support...

MsgJp:
無いよりはまし、といった程度かも
しれませんが――これが今お渡しできる品々です
どうかご武運を
MsgEn:
It may be little better than nothing, but this is
the extent of what I can offer you at the moment.
Please accept these items and may you have good
fortune in battle!

MsgJp:
ちょうど良いところにおいでくださいました
今週の支援品を準備していたのです
まだ十分とはいえませんが
ある程度は使えるかと――
MsgEn:
You have come at just the right time.
I was preparing this week's supplies.
It may not be enough, but should be useful to
some extent...

MsgJp:
覚者様、ぜひこちらをお持ちください
微力ながら、日々貴方を支援することが
王家の再興に繋がるとかたく信じております
MsgEn:
Dear Arisen, please take this with you.
I firmly believe that supporting you every day,
to the best of my abilities, will contribute to
the revival of the Royal Family.

MsgJp:
ハァ――各地にて苦境にある者からの
報告が絶えず舞い込んでくるのです
とはいえ、我々もこの有様――
MsgEn:
Haah... We are constantly receiving reports of
distress in various regions.
But even we are in this predicament...

MsgJp:
覚者様、どうか彼らにも
手を差し伸べてはいただけませんか？
その代わりにという訳ではありませんが、
稀少な素材が採れる場所をお伝えしましょう
MsgEn:
Dear esteemed Arisen, would you kindly extend a
helping hand to them as well?
It is not meant as compensation, but allow me to
share with you a location where rare materials can
be found.

MsgJp:
メガドを奪還するのであればニルビリス大橋を
確保すべきでしょう
この橋は城塞都市としての要の一つでもあります
MsgEn:
If we are to reclaim Megado, we should secure the
Great Nilviris Bridge.
This bridge is also one of the key points in our
fortress city.

MsgJp:
しかし、魔軍の連中もそのことは承知の上と見え
橋の防衛を強化しているようです
我々の戦力では突破は叶いませんが
覚者様であれば、あるいは――！
MsgEn:
However, it seems that the demon army is well
aware of this and has strengthened the defense of
the bridge.
With our current forces, breaking through is
impossible.
But if it's the Arisen, perhaps...!

MsgJp:
戦場にて共に戦えず、申し訳ありません
少しでも支援品を増やせるよう
兵たちにも物資の節約を呼びかけている次第です
MsgEn:
We regret that we cannot fight with you on the
battlefield.
We are also asking our soldiers to conserve
supplies so that we can increase our relief
supplies as much as possible!

MsgJp:
覚者様、ご無礼を承知で申し上げますが
見たところ、覚者様の武具はこの地の魔物には
少々不向きなご様子――
MsgEn:
Dear Arisen, please forgive my impoliteness, but
it seems that your equipment may be a little
unsuitable for the creatures of this land...

MsgJp:
良い素材が採れる場をご案内いたしましょう
魔物が徘徊する薄暗き水路ではありますが
覚者様であれば問題にはならないはずです
MsgEn:
Allow me to guide you to a place where you can
gather good materials.
It is a dimly lit waterway where monsters wander,
but it should not be a problem for an Arisen like
yourself.

MsgJp:
実は、悪しき竜による襲撃があった日――
同時にメガド市街に大勢のオークが姿を現したのです
城壁の外と内からの攻撃に、メガドは
一日と持ちませんでした
MsgEn:
On the day of the evil dragon's attack, a large
horde of Orcs simultaneously appeared in the
streets of Megado.
The city fell within a day, overwhelmed by
attacks from both inside and outside the walls.

MsgJp:
今思い返しても、それが妙でして――
悪しき竜の襲撃こそ突然だったものの、それまで
街の防衛に問題はなかったのです
MsgEn:
Even looking back on it now, it was strange—
The attack of the Evil Dragon was sudden, but
until then, there were no problems with the
defense of the town.

MsgJp:
いえ、仮に何者かが魔軍の侵入を手引きしたとして
それを察知できなかった近衛隊の落ち度ということに
変わりはありませんが――
MsgEn:
Even if someone aided the Demon Army's
infiltration, the fact remains that it was a lapse
in judgment on the part of the Royal Guard that
they failed to detect it.

MsgJp:
しかし、我々の情報収集能力とて
低くはないと自負しています
この規模となった今も、魔物が集まりつつある場は
把握しているのですから
MsgEn:
However, we take pride in our ability to gather
information.
Even now, at this scale, we are aware of the
areas where monsters are gathering.

MsgJp:
――我々は"メガド王宮近衛隊"
この都市と、王族をお守りするため編成されました
自力での奪還こそ叶いませんでしたが
再びここに立つことができ、感慨無量です
MsgEn:
We are the 'Megado Royal Palace Royal Guard',
organized to protect this city and the Royal
Family.
Although we were unable to recapture it on our
own, being able to stand here once again fills us
with overwhelming emotions.

MsgJp:
近衛隊元隊長ベイジル
そしてこれまでに散っていった隊員たちの魂も
我々と共に、今ここにあることでしょう
MsgEn:
Former Captain of the Royal Guard, Basil.
And the souls of the noble departed here with us,
now, in this very moment.

MsgJp:
時に――メガドには、王家の命により封鎖している
隠し扉がいくつか存在します
MsgEn:
By the way—Megado has several hidden doors sealed
by the orders of the Royal Family.

MsgJp:
しかし、この非常事態です
覚者様のお力無しに状況を打開できぬことは明白
王宮近衛隊隊長の名に於いて、全てを解放いたします
MsgEn:
However, in this state of emergency, it's clear
that we cannot overcome the situation without the
Arisen's power.
In the name of the Royal Guard's Captain, I
hereby release everything to you.

MsgJp:
城塞都市メガドが完全に"王都"として戻るまで
どうかお力をお貸しください
MsgEn:
Until the fortress city of Megado returns
completely to the "Royal Capital," please lend us
your strength.

MsgJp:
先日覚者様もご覧になったメガド回廊には
さらなる深部が存在します
MsgEn:
In the Megado Corridor, which the esteemed Arisen
has recently witnessed, there exists even deeper
sections.

MsgJp:
脅威となる魔物が跋扈していますが
それだけ、今まで調査の手が入らなかった
場でもあります――
つまり、それだけ貴重な素材が手に入るのです
MsgEn:
There are rampant threats from dangerous
monsters, which is why there hasn't been much
investigation in these areas until now.
In other words, it's an opportunity to obtain
valuable materials.

MsgJp:
異国の覚者様
これよりお話することは
他言無用にお願いいたします
MsgEn:
Master Arisen of a foreign land.
I implore you to keep what I am about to divulge
to you, a secret.

MsgJp:
王家――アッカー家の方々は
代々アッカーシェランを守護してこられました
しかし、輝かしき統治には――
陰となる部分があるのです
MsgEn:
The royal family, the Acres, have protected Acre
Selund from generation to generation.
However, even in the midst of their glorious
rule, there exists a shadow.

MsgJp:
無事のご帰還、お喜び申し上げます
アッカー家の統治無くしてアッカーシェランは無し
王家を守ることは、我らの国を守ることに
他なりません
MsgEn:
We are delighted to welcome your safe return.
Without the rule of House Acre, there would be no
Acre Selund.
Protecting the Royal Family is tantamount to
protecting our nation, nothing less.

MsgJp:
過去の古き傷ともいうべき魔物の征伐
王家に仕える者として最大の感謝を――
MsgEn:
Conquering the ancient wounds, so to speak, of
the monsters.
As a servant of the Royal Family, I am most
grateful--

MsgJp:
覚者様――我々も、再び困難に
立ち向かう覚悟はできています
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, we too are prepared to face
difficulties once again.

MsgJp:
悲観する者もいるでしょうが
ネド王子がご健在です
MsgEn:
There may be some pessimism about, but Prince
Nedo is alive and well.

MsgJp:
それに、我々兵士とて数は減ったものの
厳戒態勢を解いたわけではありません
すぐに動くことができますから
MsgEn:
Furthermore, although the number of soldiers may
have decreased, we have not lifted our state of
high alert. We can still move quickly.

MsgJp:
この世には、理解も及ばぬほどの
圧倒的な力があるのでしょうね
あの渦を見ていると、そう思わされます
MsgEn:
In this world, there is an overwhelming power
that eludes comprehension.
When I behold at that vortex, that's all I can
say.

MsgJp:
メガドの民は強いものです
――不安はあるでしょうが
生きようとしています
MsgEn:
The people of Megado are strong.
――Though they may have fears, they fight to
survive.

MsgJp:
ここまでよく来てくれた
薄暗いところだが、今のところは安全だ
少し足を休めていくといい
MsgEn:
You've come here quite far.
It's dimly lit, but for now, it's safe.
Take a moment to rest your legs.

MsgJp:
こんなことを言うのも気が引けるが
隠れ潜むのも楽なことではない――
寝床の代価として<VAL PRICE_INN>を
貰えないだろうか
MsgEn:
While I may be hesitant to say such things, it is
also not easy to beat around the bush—
Could I receive <VAL PRICE_INN> as compensation
for the use of my sleeping quarters?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
魔軍だらけのなか、よくぞ無事で
エリ警備塔まで辿り着いてくれた――
我々も数が減って寝床が余っている状態だ
自由に休んでいってくれ
MsgEn:
Amidst the sea of demon soldiers, it is truly
remarkable that you have safely made it to the Eli
Guard Tower.
We, too, have fewer numbers and more empty beds.
Please feel free to rest.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》か――
治療には物資を使わねばならない
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>あれば
準備できるが、それでもいいのか？
MsgEn:
"Treat Weakness?"
Alas, the procedure requires resources.
If <VAL PRICE_WEAK> is available we can prepare,
but is that acceptable?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》は必要ないな
ここへ来るまでに治ったんだろう
MsgEn:
There is no need to "Treat Weakness."
You must have recovered before coming here.

MsgJp:
――シッ
外は魔物だらけだ
少し声を落としてくれ
MsgEn:
Shh, there be demons out there.
Lower your voice a little.

MsgJp:
王宮が――メガドが魔軍の手に堕ちた時――
一刻も早く周辺領の諸侯たちに伝えなければと
ひたすらに走ったんだ
MsgEn:
The Royal Palace—when Megado—fell into the hands
of the demon army, I ran tirelessly, knowing that
I had to inform the feudal lords of the
surrounding territories as soon as possible.

MsgJp:
だが、そうする必要も無いことに
すぐに気付いた
MsgEn: But soon I realized that I didn't have to.

MsgJp:
危機にあったのはメガドだけではなく――
戦火はアッカーシェラン全土から
上がっていたからな
MsgEn:
It was not just Megado that was in crisis -
the flames of war were rising from all over Acre
Selund.

MsgJp:
何が起ころうとも
メガドを見放さないと決めたのは
ドリス副隊長だ
――俺も同じ気持ちだった
MsgEn:
No matter what happens, Vice Captain Doris made
the decision to never abandon Megado.
I felt the same way.

MsgJp:
必要な物があれば手配しますよ
ここで手に入るものに限りますがね
MsgEn:
If there's anything you need, I can arrange it
for you.
It's limited to what we can get here, though.

MsgJp:
メガドが襲撃された際の戦闘で
足を負傷しまして――
未だに立っていられないんです
歩く時も支え無しでは難しいですね
MsgEn:
During the battle of Megado, I sustained an
injury to my leg--
I still can't stand, and even walking is
difficult without support.

MsgJp:
――私がいなければ
皆もっと身軽に動けるのかもしれません
こんなところでじっとしていなくても――
MsgEn:
...If I weren't here, everyone might be able to
move more freely.
We wouldn't have to stay still in a place like
this...

MsgJp:
王宮近衛隊の隊士として
選ばれた日のことは忘れません
――今後剣を持って戦える日は来ないでしょう
MsgEn:
As a member of the Royal Guard, I won't forget
the day I was chosen.
—But, it seems the day to wield a sword and fight
won't come again.

MsgJp:
体調が悪けりゃ隣のおばちゃんな
で、戦技についての相談なら俺だ
MsgEn:
If you're not feeling well, you can talk to the
lady next door.
And if you need advice on combat techniques, I'm
your guy.

MsgJp:
おっと、勘違いするなよ
一応俺も癒しの術は使えるんだ
これでもプリーストの端くれだからな
MsgEn:
Oops, I should clarify.
I can also use healing magic, you know.
After all, I'm still a priest, in a way.

MsgJp:
だけど、メガドまで帰ってきたんなら
ごちゃごちゃやるより
一眠りすりゃいいんだよ、何かと
MsgEn:
But if you've made it back to Megado, instead of
messing around, just take a nap or something.

MsgJp:
危険な任務に同行させられることが多くてさ
こうやってメガド守ってればいいってなると
逆にどうしていいかわからなくなるんだよなぁ
MsgEn:
I end up being sent off on dangerous missions a
lot.
When it comes to simply guarding Megado like
this, I start to feel lost, not knowing what to do
instead.

MsgJp:
――ってわけで
とりあえず戦技の相談に乗ってるんだ
まぁこれはこれで楽しいけど
MsgEn:
--For now, I'm just helping with tactics
discussions.
Well, it's fun in its own way though.

MsgJp:
まさかとは思うけど
同じアビリティを
いつでもどこでも付けっぱなし――
なんてしてないよな？
MsgEn:
I don't think so, but you're not constantly
keeping the same Augment on at all times, right?

MsgJp:
状況に合わせて付け替える！　これが鉄則！
じゃないと前線で生き残れないぞ
MsgEn:
Change it according to the situation! This is the
ironclad rule!
Otherwise, you won't survive on the front line.

MsgJp:
大変なことになっちまったよな
空が歪むなんて――
MsgEn:
It's become rather dire, hasn't it?
The sky distorting like this...

MsgJp:
俺もまた戦闘部隊に配属されるのかな
ここの手伝いも慣れてきたところなんだけど
MsgEn:
I guess I'll be assigned to a combat unit again.
I'm just getting used to helping out here.

MsgJp:
――ま、俺なんかが考えて
どうこうなるわけじゃない
MsgEn:
--Well, it's not like thinking about it will
change anything.

MsgJp:
俺は従うよ
あんたとか、うちの隊長とか
王家の人とかにさ
MsgEn:
I will obey, whether it's you, our captain, or
someone from the Royal Family.

MsgJp:
そこのおばちゃんが全然気にしてないっぽいから
なんか俺も気楽でいられるよ
MsgEn:
That old lady over there doesn't seem to be
bothered at all.
Somehow, that puts me at ease.

MsgJp:
覚者さま――
防具をお探しなら
いくつか見立てましょうか？
MsgEn:
Dear Arisen,
If you are looking for armor, shall we consider a
few options?

MsgJp:
メガドが王家の元に戻ったとはいえ
まだ、一般市民の生活を
取り戻すとまではいきませんね
MsgEn:
Although Megado has returned to the Royal Family,
we still have a long way to go before we can
restore the lives of our citizens.

MsgJp:
覚者さまも、居住層をぐるりと
散策されてはいかがでしょう
店も一通りは開いているようです
MsgEn:
How about taking a stroll around the Residential
Level, Ser Arisen?
It seems that most of the shops are open as well.

MsgJp:
私の他にもロスギルから
派兵されている兵士がいるはずです
何人残っているのかはわかりませんが
MsgEn:
There should be other soldiers deployed from
Rothgill besides me.
I don't know how many are left, though.

MsgJp:
あ、覚者さま――
やはり、空の渦のことで
アッカーシェランに――？
MsgEn:
Ah, Master Arisen...
So, it's about the vortex in the sky.
To Acre Selund, then?

MsgJp:
わからないことがありすぎて――
信じるしか、ありませんよね
MsgEn:
There are too many things that I don't
understand...
I have no choice but to believe, right?

MsgJp:
ロスギルからは、何の指示もありません
きっとこれまで通りメガドの再興に
協力せよとのことなのでしょう
MsgEn:
We've received no instructions from Rothgill.
I suppose it means that we should continue to
support the revival of Megado as we have been
doing.

MsgJp:
空の渦、少しずつ広がっていると聞きます
いずれ全てを飲み込むつもりなのでしょうか
MsgEn:
I hear that the vortex in the sky is slowly
spreading...
Will it soon engulf all that we know?

MsgJp:
――誰か詳しく説明してくれたら
いくぶんかは安心できると思うのですけど
MsgEn:
If someone could tell me what's going on, I think
I'd be able to relax.

MsgJp:
やぁ、覚者さんじゃないですか
僕にできることあればお手伝いしますよ
例えば人を集めてくるとか――
MsgEn:
Hey, are you not Arisen?
If there's anything I can do, I'll help you out.
For example, I'm good at getting people together!

MsgJp:
ふふ、いいですよねメガド
お姉さんもお兄さんも可愛がってくれるし
何かと――便利だし
MsgEn:
Hehe, Megado is really great, isn't it?
Everyone dotes on me and it's really convenient.

MsgJp:
覚者さんと話してみたいって人
多いんですよ――知ってました？
メガドを取り戻せたのも覚者さんの
お陰って、皆知ってますから！
MsgEn:
Did you know that there are many people who want
to talk to an Arisen?
It's because everyone knows that it's thanks to
Arisen like you that we were able to reclaim
Megado!

MsgJp:
覚者さんも飲みます？
何か取ってきましょうか？
MsgEn:
Something to drink, Arisen?
Shall I get you something?

MsgJp:
すみません、あの空の渦見てると
イライラしてきちゃうんです
大変なのに、僕なんかじゃ何もできないから――
MsgEn:
Sorry, but looking at that swirling vortex in the
sky just makes me feel frustrated.
It's so daunting, and I feel like I can't do
anything about it...

MsgJp:
メガドはどうなっちゃうんでしょう
――いや、メガドというより
アッカーシェランはどうなっちゃうんでしょう
MsgEn:
What will happen to Megado?
--No, nevermind Megado, what will happen to Acre
Selund?

MsgJp:
はぁ、せっかくここまで来たのに
あの渦に全部吸い込まれて
何もかもなくなって――なんて
ごめんですよ！
MsgEn:
Ah, even though we've come all this way, to be
sucked into that vortex and lose everything...
Ah, sorry!

MsgJp:
変な魔物、増えてるらしいですね
知り合いのお兄さんたちも
討伐に駆り出されていきましたよ
MsgEn:
I've heard that strange monsters are increasing
in number.
Even my friends' older brothers have been sent
out to defeat them.

MsgJp:
やっ、こんにちは
何か売る？　それとも買う？
MsgEn:
Oh, hello there!
Looking to trade?

MsgJp:
「あっ、アレが１個足りない！」なんて時に
わざわざ自力で調達しにいくなんて
ばからしいでしょ
買えばいいんだよ、買えば
MsgEn:
When you find yourself saying, "Oh, I'm missing
one of those!"
Why go to the trouble of procuring it yourself?
That's ridiculous, right?
Just buy it, that's all you have to do, just buy
it.

MsgJp:
あーうんうん、なるほど
ちょっと手持ちが足りないって顔してるね
そんなら売ろう、何か要らない物あるでしょ
それをバザーで売っちゃえばいいよ
MsgEn:
Ah, I see. You're making a face like you're a bit
short on funds.
If that's the case, why not sell something?
I'm sure you have something you don't need.
You can just sell it at the Bazaar.

MsgJp:
倉庫の整理にもバザー活用！
半端に残ったものはサクッと売っちゃってさ
必要な時に買えばいいんだよ
MsgEn:
Utilize the bazaar for organizing your storage!
Quickly sell off the leftover items, then just
buy what you need when necessary.

MsgJp:
なぁ、何か知ってたら教えてくれよ
怖い噂ばっか聞くんだよなぁ
MsgEn:
Hey, if you know anything, let me know.
All I hear are these fearful rumors.

MsgJp:
大丈夫だよ、きっと大丈夫
あ、倉庫の整理とかしとく？
ほら、万が一の時に――
ってすべてが滅んだらそれも意味ないか――
MsgEn:
It's okay, I'm sure everything will work out.
Ah, should I take care of organizing the storage?
You know, just in case something happens.
Although it wouldn't really matter if everything
is destroyed...

MsgJp:
空の渦が全部巻き込んで、中で
粉々に砕かれるんだって噂あるでしょ
あれ、本当だと思う？
俺は――まぁそんな感じだなって思うよ
MsgEn:
Rumor has it that the vortex sucks things up and
crushes it to pieces.
Do you think it's true?
I... kind of believe it.

MsgJp:
怖い噂は色々聞こえてくるけど
それを利用してやろうって奴が出てこないのは
やっぱアレかね、ドリスたちのおかげなのかね
MsgEn:
I hear all kinds of scary rumors, but I don't
hear anyone trying to take advantage of them.
I guess that's thanks to Doris and her friends.

MsgJp:
工房を使いたいんだって？
いいとも、ポーンの技術ってのを
間近で見るまたとない機会だからね
今日は何を作るんだ？
MsgEn:
You want to use the workshop, huh?
Well, it's a rare opportunity to see the skills
of the Pawns up close.
What are we going to make today?

MsgJp:
武具をきっちり準備して
技を磨き上げて戦場に出る！
やるべきことはそれだけ！
MsgEn:
Prepare your equipment meticulously, hone your
skills to perfection, then step bravely onto the
battlefield!
That's all you need to do!

MsgJp:
死ぬ気でやれば何とかなる！
ならない時は死ぬだけ！
MsgEn:
If you give it your all, you can make it work!
If you don't, you'll just end up dead!

MsgJp:
しかし、ポーンと人間の違いって何なんだ？
私なんかは相手が言葉を話すってだけで
人間として扱いたくなるんだけど
MsgEn:
But what's the difference between Pawns and
humans, really?
For me, just their conversation makes me inclined
to see them as humans.

MsgJp:
ん？　ああ、工房なら好きに使っていいよ
あの不気味な渦のことが気になってさ――
MsgEn:
Huh? Oh, if it's about the workshop, feel free to
use it however you like.
I'm just curious about that eerie vortex...

MsgJp:
魔物が攻めてくるっていうなら
やるべきこともわかるけど
空の渦なんて――やれること、あるのか？
MsgEn:
If it's an enemy attack I know what needs to be
done, but that vortex in the sky...
Is there anything we can do?

MsgJp:
まぁ、考えてもどうにもならないな！
死ぬ時は死ぬ、それだけ！
MsgEn:
Well, there's no use dwelling on it!
When it's time to die, it's time to die.
Simple as that!

MsgJp:
ここでじっとしてるのもなぁ
いっそ戦場に出たいくらいの気持ちだ
MsgEn:
Just sitting around here feels... well, I almost
wish I could be out on the battlefield.

MsgJp:
あら～、覚者さま
わたしに何かご用かしら
MsgEn: My, Arisen, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
メガドに派兵されている人員は
それなりに戦える人ばかりだって話ですよ～
もう二度と、王都を落とされるわけには
いきませんものね
MsgEn:
The personnel being deployed to Megado are all
capable fighters, or so the story goes～
We can't afford to have the Royal Capital fall
again, after all.

MsgJp:
うふふ、覚者さまと
こうしてお話できるなんて光栄です
MsgEn:
Hehe, it's an honor to be able to talk with the
esteemed Arisen like this.

MsgJp:
え？　わたしの戦績？
これまでに始末してきた薄汚いオークの数――
数える趣味無くって
MsgEn:
Huh? My military record?
I've killed a lot of filthy Orcs--
I didn't have time to count.

MsgJp:
う～ん、これからも数えないと思います
そんな暇も無いですから
MsgEn:
Hmm, I don't think I'll have time to count from
now on.
I'm too busy for that.

MsgJp: また大変なことになりましたねぇ～
MsgEn:
Once again, things have become quite troublesome,
haven't they?

MsgJp:
諦めちゃだめだっていうのもわかりますけど
どうしようも無いことに
いつまでも抗って苦しむのも――
MsgEn:
I understand that giving up is not an option, but
constantly fighting and suffering over something
that cannot be changed...

MsgJp:
あの渦に巻き込まれて死ぬっていうのも――
オークに殺されるよりかはマシですから
MsgEn:
Dying by being caught up in that whirlpool...
It's better than being killed by an Orc, I
suppose.

MsgJp:
明日この世が終わるとしたら、ですよ
覚者さまなら何をします～？
MsgEn:
If tomorrow were the end of the world, what would
you do, Ser?

MsgJp:
ううん、覚者さまなら最後まで
竜のために戦ってそうですねぇ
MsgEn:
Well, Arisen, you'd fight for the dragon until
the bitter end, wouldn't you?

MsgJp:
――あんたもメガドにいられる間に
次の戦いへの備えを整えておくべきだな
MsgEn:
While you're at Megado, you ought to prepare for
the next battle.

MsgJp:
この辺りが一番門の状況を把握しやすい
あまり近くにいても、急な襲撃の時に
巻き込まれて戦えなくなるかもしれん
MsgEn:
This area is the best place to monitor the
situation at the gate.
Though if you're too close, you might get
ambushed.

MsgJp:
弟の仇討ちができるなら
どこにでも行くつもりだ
MsgEn:
If I can avenge my little brother's death, I'll
go anywhere.

MsgJp:
メガドを守っているより
オークを打ちのめしに行きたいんだが――
MsgEn:
Rather than protecting Megado, I want to go
pulverize the Orcs—

MsgJp:
あの空を見ろ！
落ち着いていられるか！
MsgEn:
Look at the sky!
How can I stay calm?!

MsgJp:
クソッ！
弟の仇討ちもできないままに
俺も死ぬのか！？
MsgEn:
Damn it all!
Am I going to die too without my revenge?

MsgJp:
あんたは何で涼しい顔してるんだ！？
いざとなった時には何か策でもあるのか！？
MsgEn:
Are you not affected!?
Have you a plan when the time comes!?

MsgJp:
今すぐ外に飛び出して
一匹でも多くオークを殺しに行きたい気分だ
ドリスが外に出ることを禁止してるらしいが
知ったことか！
MsgEn:
Right now, I must kill as many Orcs as I can.
Doris forbids us sortie, I don't care!

MsgJp:
はぁ――
あ、覚者様！　いえ、なんでもありません！
MsgEn:
Haah...
Oh, Ser Arisen! No, it's nothing!

MsgJp:
うぅ――また余計なことを言ってしまった――
どうしていつもこうなんだ――
MsgEn:
Ugh... I've gone and said something unnecessary
again... Why does this always happen...

MsgJp:
どうして後で気付くんでしょうね
「やっちまった」ってことに――
その場で気付けばまだやりようがあるのに
MsgEn:
Why do we always realize it later?
That we've made a mistake—
If only we had noticed it in the moment, there
would still be a way to fix it.

MsgJp:
はぁ――い、いえ、本当に大丈夫です
戦いとなれば気持ちを切り替えて
誰よりも敵を射抜いてみせますよ
MsgEn:
Haah... Yes, I assure you, everything will be
alright.
If it comes to battle, I will switch my mindset
and show you that I can strike through the enemy
better than anyone else.

MsgJp:
か、覚者様！　申し訳ございません！
自分、少々混乱しているようで
MsgEn:
Oh, esteemed Arisen! I deeply apologize for the
confusion.

MsgJp:
ああ～、このまま終わるのは嫌だ――
でも今から何ができるっていうんだ
MsgEn:
Ah, I don't want it to end like this...
But what can I do now?

MsgJp:
うぅ――あの空の渦に吸い込まれて
全部終わるだなんて――
そうとわかっていたら、もっと勇気を出して――
MsgEn:
Ugh... being sucked into that swirling vortex and
having it all end...
If only I'd known, I would've mustered up more
courage...

MsgJp:
彼女に嫌な奴だって思われたまま
死にたくない――うぅ――
MsgEn:
I don't want to die with her thinking I'm a
jerk-- Ugh--

MsgJp: はい、用件はなんです？
MsgEn: Yes, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
何か異変があれば
この身に代えても周りに知らせる――
それが役目ですから
MsgEn:
If there's any disturbance, even if it costs me
my life, I'll make sure to alert everyone...
That's my duty.

MsgJp:
まぁ、居住層には子供も多いでしょう
あまり彼らを不安にさせたくはないですね
MsgEn:
Well, there will be a lot of children in the
Residential Level.
I don't want to alarm them too much.

MsgJp:
職人や商人も、メガドを諦めなかった
今ここに戻ってきている彼らを見ると
それを実感します
MsgEn:
The artisans and merchants didn't give up on
Megado either.
I realize that when I see them back here now.

MsgJp: "滅びの渦"というのですか、あれは
MsgEn:
The "Vortex of Stagnation," is that what you call
it?

MsgJp:
さすがは覚者さま
いかなる時も泰然としていらっしゃる
MsgEn:
As expected of the Arisen, always calm and
composed no matter the situation.

MsgJp:
我々護衛兵が慌てふためいては
民が不安がりますから
「何事も無いかのように振る舞え」と
隊長に言われています
MsgEn:
If us guards were to panic, the people would
become anxious.
So we have been told by the captain to behave as
if nothing is amiss.

MsgJp:
ネド王子やメイロワ将軍も
解決のために動いていらっしゃるのでしょう
であれば、信じて――これまで通り
メガドを守るのみです
MsgEn:
Prince Nedo and General Meirova are also surely
working towards a resolution.
Believe in them, and we shall protect Megado as
we have always done.

MsgJp:
何だよ――
英雄の覚者サマが俺に何か用か？
MsgEn:
What is it――
Ser Arisen, do you have something you need from
me?

MsgJp:
一般市民に見えるような服に
着替えた方がいいのか？
どうもこの服が気に入らねぇやつが
大勢いるみたいだな
MsgEn:
Should I change into clothes that make me look
like an ordinary citizen?
Seems like there are quite a few people who don't
like this outfit.

MsgJp:
このメガドで盗みを働こうなんて思ってねぇよ
何とか力になれってここに送られてきたんだ
その位の誇りはあるぜ
MsgEn:
I ain't looking to steal from Megado.
I was sent here to help somehow.
I have that much pride at least.

MsgJp:
どこで何してようが俺の勝手だろ
あんた俺を見張ってんのか？
MsgEn:
It's my business wherever I am and whatever I do,
isn't it?
Are you spying on me?

MsgJp:
闇に覆われるってどういうことだ！？
そうなったら俺たち――死ぬのか！？
MsgEn:
What does it mean the darkness will cover us?!
Does that mean we're gonna die?!

MsgJp:
なぁ、どっか逃げた方がいいのか！？
あんた、良い場所知ってたら教えてくれよ
そこのチビ連れて逃げるからさ
MsgEn:
Hey, should we run away!?
If you know a good place, tell me! I'll take the
kids there!

MsgJp:
こういう時、兵士だったら
情報が入ってくるのかも知れねぇけど
MsgEn:
If I were a soldier, maybe I'd have some
information coming in.

MsgJp:
一般市民には何も知らされないままだ
逃げた方がいいのかもわかんねぇよ
MsgEn:
The public is left in the dark.
I don't even know if I should run.

MsgJp:
一旦アジトに戻ろうか、それとも
その時間すらないのか――
MsgEn:
Shall we go back to the hideout, or do we even
have time for that...?

MsgJp:
ああ、あんたかい
調子どう？
MsgEn:
Oh, hey you.
How's it going?

MsgJp:
賑わってるようにも見えるけど
元のメガドに戻るまで
何年かかるんだろうね
MsgEn:
It may look bustling, but I wonder how many years
it will take to return to the original Megado.

MsgJp:
王子とあんたのためなら
もう一度命を懸けてもいいよ
MsgEn:
For the Prince and for thee, I shall gladly risk
my life again.

MsgJp:
アッカーシェランは火山の国だから
日によっては灰が降ってたり
空気が煙たかったりするだろ？
でも、体に悪影響は無いものだから安心して
MsgEn:
Acre Selund is a volcanic country, so there are
days when ash falls and the air is smoky.
But don't worry, it doesn't have any negative
effects on the body.

MsgJp:
"闇"って一体何なんだい？
あんたは"闇"の正体やら原因やら、知ってる？
MsgEn:
What exactly is the "darkness"?
Do you know what it is or what causes it?

MsgJp:
実のところ、ものすごく怖いよ
こうしている間にも状況が悪化して
何もわからないままに死ぬかもしれない――
MsgEn:
To be honest, it's really scary.
While we're doing this, the situation may worsen
and we might die without knowing anything--

MsgJp:
それに対して、何にもできないだろうって
わかってるのも怖いんだ
――こんなこと、あんたにしか言えないけどね
MsgEn:
It's also scary to know that there's nothing I
can do about it.
――I can only tell you this.

MsgJp: なにも、これからって時に――
MsgEn:
Right when it feels like there's nothing left to
do...

MsgJp:
あんたの顔見たら、少しだけ安心したよ
今回も何とかなるかもしれないって
思わせる不思議な何かがあるよね
MsgEn:
When I saw your face, I felt a little relieved.
There's an air about you that makes me think that
we might be able to make it through this time too.

MsgJp:
はぁ、傷の具合が――
しかし――この程度のこと――
MsgEn:
Haah...
the extent of the wounds...
But... something of this degree...

MsgJp:
負傷したところの近くを
また切られてしまい――
それからというもの、なかなか傷が
塞がらないのです
MsgEn:
Near the wounded area, I got cut again...
Since then, the wound just hasn't been healing
well.

MsgJp:
いえ、動けないほどの傷では――
しばらくゆっくりしていれば
またすぐ前線に出られます
MsgEn:
No, it's not a wound severe enough to
incapacitate me...
If I rest for a while, I'll be back on the front
lines soon enough.

MsgJp:
覚者殿は傷の治りが早くて
羨ましいことです
それもやはり竜の加護のおかげなのですか？
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen, it is truly enviable how quickly your
wounds heal.
Is it also thanks to the divine protection of the
dragon?

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者殿
やはり来てくださったのですね
MsgEn:
Oh, Master Arisen.
I knew you'd come.

MsgJp:
覚者殿はきっと私には想像もつかないほど
たくさんのものを
ご覧になってきたのですよね
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, you must have seen so many things
that I can't even imagine.

MsgJp:
――竜が不在のまま
うまくいっている大陸を
ご覧になったことはありますか？
MsgEn:
--Have you ever witnessed a continent thriving
without the presence of dragons?

MsgJp:
この大陸を護ってくださる竜がいないから
こんなことが起きるのだと
――そう思ってしまうこともあります
MsgEn:
Because there are no dragons protecting this
continent, such things happen.
Sometimes, I can't help but think that.

MsgJp:
オークどもとの戦いで受けた傷が
いまだに塞がらないのです
気持ちが落ち込んでいるせいでしょうか
MsgEn:
The wounds I sustained in the battle against the
Orcs are still not healing.
Could it be due to my lack of spirit?

MsgJp:
はい――な、なんでしょう
何か不手際でも――
MsgEn:
Yes? W-What is it?
Did I make a mistake or something?

MsgJp:
オークが怖いとか、戦場に出たくないという
わけじゃないんですけど――
MsgEn:
It's not that I'm scared of Orcs or that I don't
want to be on the battlefield, but...

MsgJp: あの、特に面白い話もできませんが――
MsgEn: Pardon, I've naught to say...

MsgJp:
唯一、剣技だけは人よりできるのが
救いでしたね、僕の場合は
MsgEn:
The only thing I excel at is swordsmanship.
That was my saving grace, in my case.

MsgJp:
か、覚者さま！？
やっぱり、状況はそれほどに悪いんですか！？
MsgEn:
Oh ser, are you an Arisen!?
Is the situation really that bad!?

MsgJp:
このままだと世界が滅ぶって聞きました
あまりに恐ろしくて――
恐ろしすぎて、よくわからないんです
MsgEn:
I heard that if things continue like this, the
world will be destroyed.
How terrifying...
It's all too much, I really don't understand.

MsgJp:
この前は「国が滅ぶ」だったのに
今度は「世界が滅ぶ」って言われても――
MsgEn:
Last time it was "the country is dying" and now
they're saying "the world is dying"--

MsgJp:
はぁ、こんなことなら
故郷でひっそりと畑でも耕していればよかった
MsgEn:
Haah... if only I had quietly cultivated a field
in my hometown instead.

MsgJp: どうした、何か気になることでもあるのか？
MsgEn: What's wrong? Something bothering you?

MsgJp:
メガドが戻ったとはいえ
外は魔物だらけ、王宮層も壊滅状態だ
気が抜けないな
MsgEn:
Even though Megado has returned to us, the
outside is filled with enemies, and even the Royal
Palace is in a state of devastation.
I can't let my guard down.

MsgJp:
――メガドの観光案内でもしてほしいのか？
すまんが、手が空くまで待ってくれ
MsgEn:
...You want me to show you the sights of Megado?
Sorry, you'll have to wait until I'm available.

MsgJp:
そういえば、盗賊がウロウロしているんだ
持ち物には気を付けた方がいい
MsgEn:
Come to think of it, there are bandits hanging
about.
Take stock of what you bring with you.

MsgJp: こんなことになるとは――
MsgEn: I never thought it would come to this...

MsgJp:
悪しき竜の次は、空の渦か
すまない、あんたにメガドの案内を
する暇も無かったな
MsgEn:
First an evil dragon, now a vortex in the sky.
Sorry, I don't have time to give you a tour of
Megado.

MsgJp:
住民の混乱が起こらないように――
これを第一に行動すべし、とのお達しだ
MsgEn:
The directive is clear: the first priority is to
prevent panic amongst the residents.

MsgJp:
自分が兵士であることは承知の上だが
何とか此度も生き残りたい――
圧倒的な力を前にすると、そう思ってしまう
MsgEn:
I know that I'm a soldier, but I still wish to
live...
When faced with such overwhelming power, I cannot
help this.

MsgJp:
まずは一杯いかが？
料理も手軽につまめるものから
しっかり食べられるものまで！
MsgEn:
How about a drink first?
We offer a wide variety of dishes, from easy
snacks to well-prepared meals!

MsgJp:
今って、ちょっとした屋台や
食堂なんかも無いから
お腹が減った人は皆ここに来るわね
お陰で顔が広くなったわ
MsgEn:
Nowadays, there aren't even small food stalls or
cafés around.
Anyone hungry comes here to me.
Thanks to that, I've gained quite the notoriety.

MsgJp:
うちで扱ってるお酒は
強めのものが多いから
飲みすぎには気を付けてね
MsgEn:
I serve many a strong brew, so be careful not to
drink too much!

MsgJp:
私のおすすめは《特選キノコディップ》ね
手軽に食べられて、つまみにもなるの
MsgEn:
I recommend the 《Special Mushroom Dip》
It's easy to eat and makes a great snack!

MsgJp:
あら――今、それどころじゃ――
ううん、こんな時だからこそ
食べて力を付けてもらわないとね
MsgEn:
Oh... Right now, that's not the...
No, it's precisely because of times like these
that we need to eat well and gain strength.

MsgJp:
みんなとっても怖がってるわ
空にあんなものがあったんじゃ
どこかへ逃げるってわけにもいかないもの
MsgEn:
Everyone is really scared.
Having something like that in the sky...
We can't just run away somewhere.

MsgJp:
不安なのか、常連さんたちもピリピリしてて
ちょっとしたことで口げんかになることもあるの
おかげで仲裁が上手くなっちゃったわ
MsgEn:
They seem anxious, but the regulars are all on
edge these days.
They argue over the smallest things.
Because of that, I've gotten pretty good at
mediating disputes.

MsgJp:
もしも口げんかから
殺し合いになんてなったらと思うと――
それはそれで、手が震えるほど恐ろしいわ
MsgEn:
If a simple argument were to escalate into a
deadly fight...
I can't help but tremble at the thought...
'Twould be dreadful.

MsgJp:
ここに顔を出してくれてありがとう
なんだかほっとしちゃった
あなたがいるんだもの、まだ大丈夫よね
MsgEn:
Thank you for showing up, somehow it put my mind
at ease.
With you here, everything will be alright, won't
it?

MsgJp:
覚者様――
さて、どういったお話で？
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen--
Well, what's the story?

MsgJp:
メガドの傷はまだ癒えてはおりませんな
――どこかに膿でも溜まっているかもしれません
MsgEn:
The wounds of Megado have not yet healed...
There may still be bile springing up somewhere.

MsgJp:
生き残った若者たちが
怨みの感情だけで命を散らすようなことの
ないように――そのためにこの老いぼれが
いるのやもと思っております
MsgEn:
I believe that this old fool is here is trying to
prevent the surviving youngsters from giving up
their lives due to feelings of resentment alone...

MsgJp:
メガドは大きな街です
ここで暮らしてきたわし自身
この街を知り尽くしてはおりません
MsgEn:
Megado is a large place.
Despite living here myself, I don't know this
city inside out.

MsgJp:
おお、覚者様――
滅びの渦が、メガドにも――
MsgEn:
O, Arisen...
The Vortex of Stagnation has reached even
Megado...

MsgJp:
この老いぼれの身など、どうでもいいのです
ただ若者たちが心配で――
あの渦に狂わされないと良いのですが
MsgEn:
I don't care what happens to this old body.
I just worry about the young people--
I hope that vortex doesn't drive them crazy.

MsgJp:
覚者様、お忙しいことは承知の上で申し上げます
どうか、どうか、街の者にお声掛けください
それだけでいくらかは落ち着くでしょうから
今、滅びの渦を恐れぬ者はおりません――
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen, I understand that you're busy, but
please, please, reach out to the people of the
city.
Just that would bring some peace of mind.
Right now, there's no one who isn't afraid of the
Vortex of Stagnation...

MsgJp:
禍々しい空です
街では、渦に大陸ごと飲み込まれるのだとか
渦から強大な魔物が現れるのだとか
そういった噂が流れております
MsgEn:
The sky looks ominous.
There are rumors in the city about the continent
being swallowed by the vortex, and that powerful
monsters are emerging from it.

MsgJp:
実際のところは、どうなのでしょう
覚者様ならば何かご存じなのでは――
MsgEn:
In fact, I'm sure the Arisen would know something
about it...

MsgJp:
あっ、覚者さま
こんなところでどうしたんですか？
MsgEn:
Ah, Arisen.
What brings you to this place?

MsgJp:
覚者さまには助けていただきましたから！
僕も何かしたくてメガドに来たんです
MsgEn:
Due to your aid, Arisen, I have come to Megado
because I wanted to help too!

MsgJp:
解放軍に入ってもいいかなと思ったんですけど
やっぱりああいうのって向いてなくて――
MsgEn:
I thought about joining the Liberation Army, but
I realized that it's just not suited for me...

MsgJp:
――この街、意外と子供が多いですよね
親はいるのかな
MsgEn:
――There are a lot of children in this town,
aren't there?
I wonder if they have parents.

MsgJp:
覚者さま！
あの空の渦、消えますよね？！
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen!
That vortex in the sky, it will disappear, won't
it?

MsgJp:
どっ、どうしよう
今から故郷に帰っても間に合うと思いますか？
最後に親の顔を見ておきたいんですが――
MsgEn:
Oh no, what should I do?
Do you think I can make it back to my hometown in
time?
I really want to see my parents' faces one last
time...

MsgJp:
覚者さまみたいになりたくて
それでメガドに来たんです
何もできないまま終わりたくない！
MsgEn:
I wanted to be like the Arisen.
That's why I came to Megado.
I don't want to end up doing nothing!

MsgJp: 僕、何をしたらいいですか！？
MsgEn: What should I do?!

MsgJp: ――ん？　あんた、覚者さまか
MsgEn: Oh? Are you an Arisen, perhaps?

MsgJp:
俺は田舎の出だが
もう十年はメガドで暮らしている――
MsgEn:
I'm from the country, but I've been living in
Megado for a decade now--

MsgJp:
俺の築いたもの全てがメガドにあるんだ
メガドを諦めるつもりはない
どんな状況になろうとな
MsgEn:
Everything I have built is here.
I have no intention of giving up on Megado, no
matter what the conditions may be.

MsgJp:
――顔色が悪い？
気にしないでくれ
MsgEn:
... I look pale?
Don't worry about it.

MsgJp:
溜息を吐いて初めて、自分が
疲れ果てていることに気付いたよ
MsgEn:
It wasn't until I let out a sigh that I realized
I was completely exhausted!

MsgJp: 失礼、少し考え事を――
MsgEn: Excuse me, I was lost in thought for a moment...

MsgJp:
逃げられなかった者たちは
一体どうなったのか――
MsgEn: What happened to those who couldn't escape--

MsgJp:
考えたくはありませんが
我々は向かい合わねばならないのです
MsgEn: I hate to think about it, but we have to face it.

MsgJp:
前を向いて進むために
敢えて振り返らなくては――
MsgEn: To look forward, we must dare to look back--

MsgJp: 今できることを、やろうと思います
MsgEn: I'm going to do what I can right now.

MsgJp:
あ、覚者さん
こんにちは――
MsgEn: Oh, hello, Arisen--

MsgJp:
盗賊のお兄さんがメガドに
連れてきてくれたんです
あたしの村は焼けちゃったから
MsgEn:
My bandit brother brought me to Megado because my
village was burnt down.

MsgJp: 雑貨屋さんなら、店番で雇ってくれないかなぁ
MsgEn:
I wonder if a general store would hire me as a
shopkeeper.

MsgJp:
これからどうするのか、なんて聞かないで
ううん――覚者さんがパパやママの代わりを
してくれるなんて思ってないから、大丈夫
MsgEn:
Don't ask what I'm going to do from now on.
No, I don't expect you, Arisen, to replace my
parents.
It's okay.

MsgJp:
ハ～イ、ステキな覚者さん
もっと輝いてみない？
気分転換にもいいわよぉ
MsgEn:
Hey there, lovely Arisen.
How about I help you shine even brighter?
It's good to keep it fresh, you know.

MsgJp:
人のお洒落をお手伝いするのって
とってもワクワクするの
MsgEn: Helping others refashion is always so exciting!

MsgJp:
だって、あたしの技術で"人"が変わるのよ
ふふっ、スリルあるでしょぉ？
――わからない？
MsgEn:
After all, my techniques change people.
Hehe, isn't that thrilling?
-- You feel me?

MsgJp:
今の気分やお気に入りの装備に合わせて
メイクや髪型を変えてみない？
お洒落はトータルバランスが大事なのよぉ
MsgEn:
Why don't you try changing your makeup and
hairstyle to match your current mood and favorite
equipment?
In fashion, overall balance is important, you
know.

MsgJp:
似合わないスタイルがあるって――諦めてない？
ちょっと調整するだけで
似合うようになるんだからぁ！
MsgEn:
Have you given up on a style that doesn't suit
you?
Just a little adjustment is all it takes to make
it look good!

MsgJp:
"諦め"はお洒落ゴコロの敗北よ
"挑戦"こそお洒落の真髄ってねぇ
MsgEn:
"Giving up" is the defeat of stylish spirit,
while "taking on challenges" is the very essence
of style, you know.

MsgJp:
うんうん、もっとイイ感じにしちゃいましょ！
スタイリングは<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>よ
声やポーンの喋り方なんかはオマケするから
気軽に変えてみてねぇ
MsgEn:
Yeah, yeah, let's make it better!
The styling is <COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>.
I'll do the voice and Pawn speech as a freebie.
Feel free to change it!

MsgJp:
うんうん、もっとイイ感じにしちゃいましょ！
スタイリングは<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>よ
今なら特別に<COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_TK>でも大丈夫！
声やポーンの喋り方なんかはオマケするから
気軽に変えてみてねぇ
MsgEn:
Alright, alright! For styling, you can pay with
<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>.
And for a limited time only, you can also get it 
for <COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_TK>!
We'll even throw in voice and Pawn dialogue
changes as a bonus, so feel free to customize to
your heart's content!

MsgJp:
えっ、どこどこ？
――ねぇ、あなたポーンと契約してないんじゃない？
ポーンって確か、リムストーンを集めて
契約の儀式しないといけないのよぉ
MsgEn:
Huh, where now?
Hey, you haven't contracted a pawn, have you?
I think you have to gather Riftstones and perform
a ritual to contract a pawn.

MsgJp:
ポーンと契約したら、いつかその子のことも
あたしにスタイリングさせてねぇ
MsgEn:
If you sign a contract with a pawn, you should
let me style them someday, ok?

MsgJp:
わかるわ！　いいわよねぇ、燃えるわよねぇ
<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>ポッキリで
とびきりステキになるようにお手伝いしちゃう！
MsgEn:
Alright! It's great, isn't it?
It's so exciting!
Let me help you become absolutely fabulous, it's
only <COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL><VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>!

MsgJp:
わかるわ！　いいわよねぇ、燃えるわよねぇ
いつもは<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>もらってるんだけど
今だけ特別に<COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_TK>でも大丈夫よ
とびきりステキになるようにお手伝いしちゃう！
MsgEn:
Alright! Great, right? It's burning up in here!
I usually take <COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>,
but for now, it's also okay to use <COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_TK> as a special offer.
I'll help you become absolutely fabulous!

MsgJp:
あはは、<COL b92828>男性か女性専用のアイテム</COL>を装備したままだと
転生したところで合う服が無くなっちゃう！
専用品ははずしてから来てねぇ
MsgEn:
Haha, if you leave your <COL b92828>male or
female</COL> exclusive items equipped, they won't
fit when you reincarnate!
Take off the exclusive items before you come!

MsgJp:
大変よね、わかるわぁ
こんな時こそ気合入れなきゃ、でしょぉ？
MsgEn:
It's tough, I know.
It's times like this when you have to keep your
spirits up, right?

MsgJp:
まかせて！
いつも以上に気合が入るように
ばっちりコーディネートしちゃうんだから
MsgEn:
Leave it to me!
I'll give it my all, more than ever before, and
coordinate everything perfectly.

MsgJp:
ポーンのメイクや髪型なんかも
変えていかない？
気合の入ったポーンを連れていれば
力が湧いてくるかもしれないわよぉ
MsgEn:
Why don't you change your pawn's makeup and hair?
Having a pawn with some spunk might give you a
boost!

MsgJp:
いついかなる時でも、おしゃれは必要よぉ
"その時々に合わせたおしゃれ"ってやつ！
MsgEn:
No matter when, fashion is always necessary, you
know!
It's all about dressing for the occasion!

MsgJp:
ああ、珍しい物を持ってるね
鑑定交換してみないかい？
MsgEn:
Ah, you have something rare.
Would you like to exchange appraisal items?

MsgJp:
珍しいものを欲しがる貴族は多いんだよ
役に立たないものでもやたらと集めたがったりね
おかしな人たちだろ
MsgEn:
There are a lot of aristocrats who want rare
things, even if they're not useful.
They're funny people, aren't they?

MsgJp:
若い頃に貴族の屋敷で世話になってたんだ
お陰で見る目だけは養われたよ
MsgEn:
I was raised in a nobleman's mansion when I was
young, and it gave me a good eye for this line of
work.

MsgJp:
鑑定の結果が君の気に入るものに
なるかはわからないけど――
でも、価値のわからないまま
持ち続けるよりはいいと思うな
MsgEn:
I don't know if the result of the appraisal will
be to your liking, but...
I think it's better than holding onto something
without knowing its value.

MsgJp:
――"滅びの渦"か
ああ、ごめん
いつもの鑑定交換かな？
MsgEn:
"Vortex of Stagnation," huh?
Ah, sorry. Is this our usual appraisal exchange?

MsgJp:
すべてが滅びてしまうって言われてるね
本当かな――確かに、あの空は不気味だけど
MsgEn:
I've heard it said that everything will perish.
I wonder if it's true... Certainly, 'tis a woeful
sky.

MsgJp:
この際、滅びた方がいいものも
あるかもしれないよね
MsgEn:
In these circumstances, perhaps there are some
things that are better off destroyed.

MsgJp:
真価を発揮させないまま
諸共に消え失せてしまうなんて
もったいないと思わないかい
MsgEn:
'Twould be a shame to let them all disappear
without realizing their full potential.

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ
あなたとあなたの竜のため、祈りましょう
MsgEn:
Arisen of the White Dragon, let us pray, for you
and the dragon.

MsgJp:
白き竜――
とても長い間生きている竜のよう
MsgEn:
The White Dragon—
it seems to have lived for a very long time.

MsgJp:
アッカーシェランの竜とは
生まれ方が異なるのですね
MsgEn:
The Dragon of Acre Selund seems to have a
different origin.

MsgJp:
《復活力》の加護は
1度に3回分授けられます
大切になさってください
MsgEn:
The Divine Protection of "Revival Power" can be
bestowed 3 times at once.
Cherish it well.

MsgJp:
かすかに――白き竜以外の竜力も感じます
どうしてでしょう、不思議な方ですね
MsgEn:
Faintly... I can feel Dragon Force, not just from
the White Dragon.
Why could that be? You're quite mysterious.

MsgJp:
竜よ、覚者を加護する竜よ
三たびの苦難に見舞われようと
立ち上がる力をこの者に――
MsgEn:
O dragon, bestow your divine protection upon the
Arisen.
Even if they are struck by adversity thrice,
Grant them the strength to stand once more—

MsgJp:
今のあなたには、さらなる
《復活力》の加護は不要でしょう
ご武運を――
MsgEn:
You have no need of more "Revival Power" at this
point.
Good fortune to you.

MsgJp:
今この時に新たな復活力を授かるということは
残っている復活力を捨てることになります
それでも良いのですね？
MsgEn:
Accepting the grace of "Revival Power" at this
moment will mean discarding any remaining charges
you have.
Are you sure you want to proceed?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ
残念ですが、すでに本日の《復活力》の加護を
受け取っておいでですね
MsgEn:
O Arisen of the White Dragon.
Unfortunately, it seems that you have already
received today's Divine Protection of "Revival
Power".

MsgJp:
では、今日も大いなる竜のご加護が
あらんことを――
MsgEn:
May the great Divine Protection of the Dragon be
with us today as well...

MsgJp:
覚者様、こちらが本日分の
任証スタンプと支給品でございます
どうぞお受け取りください
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen, here are today's stamps and supplies.
Please accept them.

MsgJp:
ええ、覚者様は本日分の
任証スタンプと支給品を
すでにお持ちのご様子――
ご武運を
MsgEn:
Yes, it appears that you, Ser Arisen, already
have today's stamp and supplies in your
possession.
May the fortunes of war be with you.

MsgJp:
おめでとうございます！
覚者様の日頃のご活躍に対し
特別な任証スタンプと支給品が届いております
MsgEn:
Congratulations and thank you for your daily
support!
You have received a special stamp and supplies
for your continued service.

MsgJp:
さぁ、どうぞお受け取りください
覚者様の旅路にさらなる竜の祝福があらんことを
MsgEn:
Now, please take it.
May there be further blessings of the dragon on
the journey of the esteemed Arisen.

MsgJp:
今、アッカーシェランを守護する竜はおりません
白き竜の覚者よ、この地の者は
あなたを頼るほかないのです
MsgEn:
There is no longer any dragon protecting Acre
Selund.
Arisen of the White Dragon, the people of this
land have naught else to turn but you.

MsgJp:
私にできることは祈ることのみ
絶え間なくあなたの勝利を――
理の勝利を祈りましょう
MsgEn:
The only thing I can do is pray.
Unceasingly, I pray for your victory—
I pray for the victory of order.

MsgJp:
大いなる加護が
あなたにあらんことを
MsgEn: May the great Divine Protection be with you.

MsgJp:
どんな武器をお望みで？
色々と取り揃えてはおりますから
いくつか手に取ってみてください
MsgEn:
What kind of weapon you looking for?
We have a wide selection, feel free to heft them.

MsgJp:
地方の拠点からも、メガドを護るためと
兵士が派遣されてきているんです
おかげで早々に店を立て直すことができましたが――
MsgEn:
Even from our regional bases, soldiers have been
sent to protect Megado.
Thanks to them, we were able to get the store
back up and running as soon as possible, but--

MsgJp:
良品を扱っているつもりですが
覚者さまほどの方に
気に入っていただける品があるかどうか
MsgEn:
I believe I handle quality products, but I wonder
if there are items that would please even a person
of your caliber, Ser Arisen.

MsgJp:
メガドは――どうです？
異国からいらした覚者さまから見て――
MsgEn:
Megado, how do you like it?
From the perspective of a wise visitor from a
foreign land...

MsgJp:
覚者さま！
あの渦は――アッカーシェランは
どうなってしまうのでしょう
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen!
That vortex - what will happen to Acre Selund?

MsgJp:
メガドがかつてのようなにぎわいを
取り戻す日を、心待ちにしていたんです
MsgEn:
I've been looking forward to the day when Megado
will return to the bustling atmosphere it once
had!

MsgJp:
こんなことになるなんて――
言葉がありません
MsgEn:
I can't believe it has come to this... I have no
words.

MsgJp:
店を開けてはいるものの
空のことばかりが気になります
MsgEn:
Although the shop is open, I can't help but be
preoccupied with the sky.

MsgJp:
ん？　なんだなんだ
武具をもっと強くすることに
興味があるのか？
MsgEn:
Huh? What's this about?
Are you interested in making your equipment
stronger?

MsgJp:
ふっふっふ！
人間の鍛冶屋として
「ポーンのクラフト技術が最高」と
言われているのがしゃくでな
MsgEn:
Heh heh heh!
As a human blacksmith, it chafes me to hear that
'Pawn craftsmanship is the best.'

MsgJp:
ポーンにできないことをやってやろうと
あらゆる鍛冶の知識を漁ってきたんだわい
MsgEn:
I've been scouring every bit of blacksmithing
knowledge I could find to do what pawns can't.

MsgJp:
ドワーフオークは鍛冶に長けとるでな
もちろん奴らの技術も研究したぞ
――だが《戦甲》については予想外だったなぁ
MsgEn:
Dwarf Orcs sure have a knack for blacksmithing,
ya know.
Of course, I've also studied their techniques.
But I must say, their "Battle Armor" was quite
unexpected.

MsgJp:
あんたにも
"思い入れがあって捨てられない武具"
ってやつがあるだろう
そういう武具にもう一度陽の目を見せてやらんか？
MsgEn:
There must be equipment that you've grown
attached to and cannot simply discard, right?
Wouldn't you like to give such equipment another
chance to see the light of day?

MsgJp:
ほうほう、なかなかの武具だ
こいつを土台にするんだな！
MsgEn:
Ah, this is quite a formidable piece of
equipment. We'll use this as our foundation!

MsgJp:
慌てるな、慌てるな――
まずは手の届く範囲、目に見える範囲から
そう、武具の強化だわい
MsgEn:
Don't panic, don't panic—
First, start with what's within reach, what you
can see.
Yes, it's about strengthening your equipment.

MsgJp:
大地の竜力は吸い上げられ
恐ろしい魔物が現れているそうだな
太刀打ちできる武具を鍛えねばなるまい
MsgEn:
The Dragon Force is being siphoned from the land,
and fearsome creatures are emerging.
We must forge weapons capable of standing against
them.

MsgJp:
あんたを信じているからな
逃げも隠れもせん
ここで、今までどおり武具を鍛えるまで
MsgEn:
I trust you, so I won't flee or hide.
I'll stay here and forge weapons just as I always
have, until the end.

MsgJp:
これまでで一番の武具が必要になる
そして、そのためにはわしの力が必要
――そうだろう？　ワッハッハ
MsgEn:
The need for the best weapons we've ever had
arises, and for that, my strength is required—
Am I right? Wahahaha!

MsgJp: どうした、何か不都合でもあるのか？
MsgEn: What's wrong, something the matter?

MsgJp:
具合が悪いならそう言え
タダでとはいかないが
<VAL PRICE_INN>で寝床を用意してやる
どうだ、休んでいくのか？
MsgEn:
If you're feeling unwell, just say so.
It won't be for free, but I can provide you with
a place to sleep at <VAL PRICE_INN>.
So, will you take a rest?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
具合が悪いなら寝床を用意してやる
ま、あんたみたいな人間が普段寝てるような
静かで柔らかい寝床じゃあないがな
――それでもいいか？
MsgEn:
If you're feeling unwell, I'll prepare a sleeping
area for you.
Well, it won't be the kind of quiet and soft bed
that someone like you usually sleeps in, though.
Is that still alright?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》か
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>払えるっていうなら
ここで治してやるぜ
手持ちの金は十分か？
MsgEn:
If you can pay <VAL PRICE_WEAK>, then I'll treat
your weakness right here.
Have you that on hand?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
――面白くもない冗談はやめろ
そういうことをやってると
本当に《弱化》した時に困るぞ
MsgEn:
--Stop with the unfunny jokes.
If you keep doing things like that, you'll really
be in trouble when you're actually weakened.

MsgJp:
ここで寝ようと思ったら
人の話し声や足音は絶えねぇうえに
誰かが食ってる飯の臭いはするしで
最初は苦労するかもしれねぇな
MsgEn:
If you're thinking of sleeping here, know this.
You'll be hearing conversation and footsteps all
through the night, and you'll catch the smell of
someone eating.
It may be tough at first.

MsgJp:
でも、慣れるとそれが
"安心する物音"になるんだ
不思議だろ
MsgEn:
But once you get used to it, that becomes a
"reassuring sound".
Strange, isn't it?

MsgJp:
おい、外に出たら
また魔軍との戦いだろうが
準備は万端にしていけ
MsgEn:
Hey, listen up!
Once you step outside, you'll be facing the demon
horde again.
Make sure you're fully prepared.

MsgJp:
言っておくが、お前の心配をしてるんじゃない
アッカーシェランの心配をしてるんだ
お前には万全の状態で出発してもらわないと困る
MsgEn:
I'll tell you this, but I'm not worried about you.
I'm worried about Acre Selund.
I need you departing in perfect condition.

MsgJp:
ん？　何か欲しいものでもあるのか？
きっちり金を払っていくってんなら
いくらでも分けてやるよ、へへへ
MsgEn:
Hm? What is it you desire?
If you're willing to pay, I've plenty to share
with you, hehehe.

MsgJp:
ハハハ――
俺たちから盗もうなんて思うなよ
そうなったら、盗り戻すまでだからな
MsgEn:
Hahaha!
Don't even think about stealing from us 'cause if
you do, we'll take it right back.

MsgJp:
まぁ、くつろいでいけよ
セロがあんたを受け入れたんなら
俺らがどうこう言うものでもないからさぁ
MsgEn:
Well, just relax and make yerself at home.
If Cyril's good with ya, then we've no right to
say nothing.

MsgJp:
普段何をして暮らしてるか？
へへ、あんた面白いこと言うじゃないか
盗賊にそんなこと聞くもんじゃないよ
MsgEn:
What do you do for a living?
Heh, you're funny.
You shouldn't ask such things to a thief.

MsgJp:
同行する仲間が必要なのか？
俺が手配してやってもいいが――
お前が俺を信じるなら、だな
MsgEn:
Need a companion to accompany you?
I can arrange it for you--
if you trust me.

MsgJp:
何も盗賊を集めてきて
お前と一緒に旅をさせようってんじゃない
安心しろ
MsgEn:
I'm not gathering a bunch of bandits to go on a
journey with you.
Don't worry.

MsgJp:
アーシェって娘を見たか？
あの子はセロの実の娘でな――
見かけたら様子を見てやってくれ
MsgEn:
Have you seen Ashe, Cyril's daughter?
She's not actually his biological daughter
though.
If you happen to see Ashe, keep an eye on her.

MsgJp:
何をうろうろしてる
そこらの椅子に座ってもいいんだぞ
盗賊のねぐらなんかじゃ
落ち着いてられないってか？
MsgEn:
What are you wandering around for?
You can sit on any chair around here, you know.
Can't relax in a den of thieves, huh?

MsgJp:
えーっと、なに？
あたし、顔に何か付いてる？
MsgEn:
Uhm, what?
Do I have something on my face?

MsgJp:
あたしたちだって
アッカーシェランの人間だよ
火竜さまの恩恵を受けて生きてきてるんだから
MsgEn:
We're people from Acre Selund too, you know.
We've been living under the blessing of the Fire
Dragon.

MsgJp:
――ちょっと"事情"がある人だらけだけど
ええと、その――火竜さまへの気持ちは
街の人たちとちょっとも変わんないってこと！
MsgEn:
There are a lot of people with "circumstances"
here, but well, my feelings towards Lord Fire
Dragon are no different from the people in town!

MsgJp:
ウチの人たちって目つき悪い人、多いでしょ？
でもみんな優しい人たちなんだよ
あんまり悪く思わないで
MsgEn:
I know our people might seem a bit intimidating
at first, with their stern expressions.
But they're all genuinely kind-hearted
individuals.
Judge them not too harshly.

MsgJp:
うーん――
何、あたしだって悩むことくらいあるよ
MsgEn:
Hmmm--
What? I have problems too!

MsgJp:
物資ならいくらか持ってきてやった
何が必要か、言ってみろ
MsgEn:
If it's supplies you require, I can bring some.
Just tell me what you need.

MsgJp:
こんなところ近付きたくはないが
――何でも、お前らにかかってるらしいじゃねえか
物資くらいなら運んできてやる
MsgEn:
I'd rather not be around this place...
-- But I hear it's all up to you guys, huh?
I'll at least keep you supplied.

MsgJp:
感謝するならうちの頭領にしとけ
俺は言われて運んできてるだけだ
MsgEn:
If you want to thank me, you should thank our
chieftain.
I only bring it as instructed.

MsgJp:
うちの奴らだけじゃなく
ベルタんとこの奴らにも気に入られてるらしいな
あんた、こういう稼業にも向いてるんじゃないか
MsgEn:
It seems like not only my crew but also Bertha's
lot are fond of you.
You might have a knack for this kind of work, you
know.

MsgJp:
先に進む覚悟は――どう？
一緒に行く相手がいないなら
アタシが声かけてこようか？
MsgEn:
Are you ready to head on?
If you don't have anyone to accompany you, I
could suggest some folks.

MsgJp:
なるようにしかならないもんさ
あんまり気負わずにいけばいい
――なんて言っても
結局はあんたにかかってるんだけどね
MsgEn:
What will be, will be.
Don't get too worked up.
... Even though that's what they say, in the end,
it all depends on you.

MsgJp:
火垂れ山の中は暑いだろうけど
頭の方は冷静さを心掛けな
熱と緊張でイカれて命を落とさないように
MsgEn:
It must be hot inside the Firefall Mountain, but
keep a cool head.
Stay your mind under the duress of heat and you
may end up keeping your life.

MsgJp:
そうだ――
戦技を見直してから行きなよ
ユセフが相談にのってくれるからさ
MsgEn:
That's right...
Reevaluate your combat skills before you go.
Youssef will give you advice, so consult with him.

MsgJp:
体調と戦技、それから装備――
覚者殿には万端の状態でいていただかねば
MsgEn:
Physical condition, combat skills, and equipment—
It is essential for the Master Arisen to be in
perfect condition.

MsgJp:
ここでお休みになるならば<VAL PRICE_INN>です
この荒れ地で寝床を確保するために必要でして――
覚者殿、どうかご了承ください
MsgEn:
If you wish to take a rest here, the price is
<VAL PRICE_INN>.
It is necessary to secure a place to sleep in
this barren land...
Master Arisen, please understand.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
寝心地がいいとはお世辞にも言えぬ寝床ですが
どうぞお休みください
体調を整えていただくことが最優先です
MsgEn:
While I can't exactly call this bed comfortable,
please rest well.
Your well-being is our top priority, so please
take the time to recover.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》でしょうか
治療に必要な物資にも限りがあるため
どうしても<VAL PRICE_WEAK>ほど
いただかねばならぬこと、お許しを――
MsgEn:
Is it "Treat Weakness"?
Because there is a limited supply of resources
for treatment, there is no choice but to ask for
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
Please, understand, and forgive me――

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
覚者殿、申し上げにくいことですが
《弱化》されていないようです
ええ、間違いなく《弱化》されていません
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, 'tis difficult for me to really
say, but it seems that you have not been weakened.
Yes, without a doubt.

MsgJp:
"あの時"メガドを護りきれなかった我らです
"今"できることをやらせてください
MsgEn:
We couldn't protect Megado back then.
Let us do what we can do now!

MsgJp:
火垂れ山へもお供したいのは山々ですが
――我らでは足手まといになるだけでしょう
ここでお待ちしております
MsgEn:
While we would love to accompany you to Firefall
Mountain, we fear we would only hinder your
progress.
--We shall await your return here.

MsgJp:
突然の怪我や物資不足――
他にも、何かあった時には
すぐにこのキャンプへお戻りください
そのために我々がいるのですから
MsgEn:
Sudden injury or lack of supplies--
If you have any other problems, please return to
this camp immediately.
That's what we're here for!

MsgJp:
――お前さん
なかなか見どころがありそうじゃの
MsgEn:
--You've got something special about you, I can
tell.
I'm intrigued.

MsgJp:
その気があるならワシのとっておきを
教えてやらんでもないが
MsgEn:
If you're interested, I could share some of my
insider knowledge with you.

MsgJp:
海竜リンドブルムに座礁船
ここからでも浜辺の様子はよぉ見えるわい
お前さんが来る様子もな
MsgEn:
Ship stranded on Lindwurm.
I can see the beach just fine from here.
And I can see you coming, too.

MsgJp:
このモルトバ灯台はな、今でこそ
神殿から出る洋撃船専用みたいに
なっとるが、もっと昔の時代からあったそうじゃ
MsgEn:
The Moltova Lighthouse now seems to be
exclusively for the ocean-bound ships leaving from
the temple, but apparently, it has been around
since ancient times.

MsgJp:
外洋が穏やかでヒュージブルもおらず
数多の船が浜の村から出ていた時代にな
MsgEn:
In the era when the open sea was calm and there
was no Brine, many ships used to depart
from the village on the beach.

MsgJp:
んん？
何じゃ、わざわざこんな所に
何をしにきた、特にもてなしもできんぞ
MsgEn:
Huh? What brings you all the way here?
Can't offer much hospitality in a place like this.

MsgJp:
ほう――
そっちの話か、良かろう
MsgEn:
Oh, that's what you're after.
Alright then.

MsgJp:
ワシはルドルフォ
見ての通り灯台守じゃが、かつては白騎団で
《シールドセージ》の教官をしておった
MsgEn:
I am Rudolfo.
As you can see, I am the lighthouse keeper.
Formerly, I used to be an Instructor of the White
Knights, teaching the ways of the Shield Sage.

MsgJp:
お前さん、《シールドセージ》として経験を積み
護りのイロハは体得したようじゃの
MsgEn:
Seems you've gained experience as a Shield Sage,
and mastered the basics of protection.

MsgJp:
大盾で敵の攻撃を受けとめ、それを反撃の力たる
フォースへ転化する――
MsgEn:
With the Greatshield, you can intercept the
enemy's attacks and convert them into the power to
counterattack--

MsgJp:
そして、敵の注目を一身に集めることで
仲間の攻撃機会を増やす
MsgEn:
And by drawing the enemy's attention to oneself,
increase the opportunities for your allies to
attack.

MsgJp:
もう分かっているだろうが
その大盾は、お前さんのみを守るものにあらず
仲間のための砦でもある
MsgEn:
You should already have grasped this.
That Greatshield is not only for your protection,
but is also a fortress for your comrades.

MsgJp:
力量はもう十分じゃ
ワシの出す試練を乗り越え、さらなる精進を
してみんか？
MsgEn:
Your strength is already enough.
How about overcoming the trials I present and
striving for further improvement?

MsgJp:
よしよし
護りのイロハは体得したようじゃの
MsgEn:
Good, good, it seems you've mastered the basics
of protection.

MsgJp:
では、《シールドセージ》として
本格的に鍛錬を積むがよい
MsgEn:
Then, it's time to undergo some rigorous training
as a Shield Sage!

MsgJp:
お前さん、かなり護りの術に
長けてきたようじゃの
MsgEn:
You're getting pretty good at the art of
self-defense, aren't you?

MsgJp:
よし――
ではそろそろ、もう一歩踏み込んだ
技を覚えてみるか
MsgEn:
Alright――
Then, it's about time to learn a more advanced
technique.

MsgJp:
うむ、《シールドセージ》に興味があるのか？
――シールドセージはもともと騎士団と戦に
赴いたプリーストの一団が、防護術に特化し
開いた職と言われていてな
MsgEn:
Ah, are you interested in the Shield Sage?
The Shield Sage is said to be a vocation that was
originally formed by a group of priests who joined
the Knights Order and specialized in defensive
magic.

MsgJp:
もっとも大きな差は、自身の精神力だけでなく
敵が攻撃に使う力そのものを、護りの力に転化
したという点じゃ
MsgEn:
The biggest difference is that we have converted
not only our own mental power, but also diversion
of the enemy's attack into the power to protect.

MsgJp:
敵の攻撃を防ぎ、かつ力として吸収する大盾は
あれで呪具でもある
MsgEn:
The Greatshield that blocks enemy attacks and
absorbs them as power also serves as a tool of
magic.

MsgJp:
ロッドと対で使うことで
力を《フォース》として蓄積し、制御するのじゃ
――む？　ちょっと難しかったかの？
MsgEn:
Used in conjunction with a rod, it stores and
controls power as "Force".
-- Hmm?　Shall I reiterate?

MsgJp:
要するに、じゃ
敵の力すら利用し、己自身が皆を守る盾となる者
それがシールドセージということじゃよ
MsgEn:
In short, a Shield Sage is someone who not only
harnesses the power of their enemies, but also
becomes a shield to protect everyone.

MsgJp:
お前さん
《エンチャント》は使っておるか？
MsgEn: Are you using "Enchant" abilities?

MsgJp:
火や氷、雷、そして聖に闇
魔物どもには弱点というべき
苦手属性があることが多くてな
MsgEn:
Fire, ice, lightning, as well as holy and dark—
many monsters have weaknesses or attributes they
are vulnerable to.

MsgJp:
そこを突けるかどうかで、戦いの流れは
全く変わると言っても過言ではない
弱点属性をエンチャントしてやれば
味方の火力は一気に上がるじゃろう
MsgEn:
It is not an exaggeration to say that the flow of
battle can completely change depending on whether
or not you can exploit that weakness.
By enchanting the right attribute, your allies'
firepower will increase significantly.

MsgJp:
《フォース》に属性の力を帯びさせ
武器へ付与する
それがシールドセージのもう一つの
大きな役割じゃな
MsgEn:
Infusing the power of enchantments from "Force"
and applying it to weapons—
that's another significant role of the Shield
Sage.

MsgJp:
ふううむ、目を見張る成長じゃ
お前さんに、ワシのとっておきを
伝授する時がきたようだの
MsgEn:
Hmm, your growth is truly remarkable.
It seems that the time has come for me to impart
my special knowledge to you, my dear apprentice.

MsgJp:
《シールドセージ》の真髄とは
己自身が仲間を守る砦となること
そして戦いの行方を導く、確かな
灯台となることじゃ
MsgEn:
The essence of the "Shield Sage" is to become a
fortress that protects one's comrades, and to be a
reliable beacon that guides the course of battle.

MsgJp: それを心して、この技を修得するがよい
MsgEn: Keep that in mind as you master this technique.

MsgJp:
なんじゃお前さん
戦技についての話か？
MsgEn:
What's on your mind, stranger?
Are you here to discuss combat skills?

MsgJp:
そうじゃな――ならまずは――
《シールドセージ》となり
ジョブレベル１８を目指すといい
MsgEn:
Well, then, first of all, you should become a
"Shield Sage" and aim for job level 18.

MsgJp:
その後、神殿の訓練官――
たしかレンテンとかいったかのう
あの者から正式にワシへの修練紹介を
出してもらうがよい
MsgEn:
After that, the temple trainer-- I think it's
Renton or something like that-- can give you a
formal introduction to my training.

MsgJp:
その時こそ直伝の技を教えてやろう
それまではよく護り、鍛えるのじゃ
MsgEn:
Only then will I teach you the techniques
directly.
Until then, protect and train well.

MsgJp:
ほほぉ、シールドセージとして
なかなか励んでおるようじゃの
そのレベルであれば、より高度な技術を
学んでよい頃かもしれん
MsgEn:
Oh, so you're working hard as a Shield Sage I see.
At your level, it might be a good time to learn
more advanced techniques.

MsgJp:
とはいえ、急にワシが修練してやるのは
筋違いじゃな
覚者であれば神殿の訓練官――
レンテンとか言ったかのう？
MsgEn:
That said, it wouldn't be right for me to
suddenly start training you.
If you're an Arisen, you should seek out the
Temple's Training Officer -- I believe his name
was Renton.

MsgJp:
まずはあやつに一報を入れてから
この道を深めるかどうか
今一度考えてみるとよい
MsgEn:
I suggest you contact that individual first and
then reconsider whether to delve further into this
path.

MsgJp:
あらぁ、わざわざこんな所に何の用？
魔女が住んでるって噂でも
聞いてきたのかしら？　ふふふ
MsgEn:
Oh my, what brings you all the way here?
Did you come to inquire about the rumors of a
witch residing here? Hehehe.

MsgJp:
術士として見込みがありそうなら
特別に教えてあげてもいいわよ
MsgEn:
If you show promise as a sorcerer, I might
consider teaching you something special.

MsgJp:
ソーサリーと呼ばれる
今やこの地から失われゆく魔術の極意をね
あなた、興味ある？
MsgEn:
Are you interested in learning the secrets of
Sorcery, a form of magic that has all but vanished
from this land?

MsgJp:
魔術の真髄は森羅万象への理解
自然の中で一体となり
頭と身体で感じる事が大切なのよ
MsgEn:
The essence of magic lies in understanding the
vastness of nature.
It is crucial to become one with nature, to feel
it with both your mind and body.

MsgJp: あらぁ、わざわざこんな所に何の用？
MsgEn: Oh, what are you doing all the way out here?

MsgJp:
――あら、パトリシアからの紹介？
なら、見込みある人みたいね
MsgEn:
Oh, Patricia sent you?
Well, it seems like you have potential.

MsgJp:
あたくしはエメラダ、《ソーサラー》よ
大きすぎる破壊の力ゆえ
今は神殿で禁じられた術――魔術を伝えているの
MsgEn:
I am Emerada, a "Sorcerer."
The Temple has deemed Sorcery too dangerous, they
have banished it from their teachings.
Yet, I continue to instruct those who seek to
harness its power.

MsgJp:
世界を包む霊、質、量、法則を知り
望む力を生みだす技、その根源は
生死や世界そのものの成り立ちにまで
深く繋がっているわ
MsgEn:
Knowledge in the spirits, essences, quantities,
and laws that envelop the world, the technique
that produces the power you seek is deeply
connected to the very foundation of life, death,
and the origins of existence itself.

MsgJp:
ふふ、もしかしたら神殿が禁じたのは
そういう所が、例のあの学問と似ているから――
かもしれないわね
MsgEn:
Hehe, perhaps the reason the temple forbade it is
because such knowledge cuts too close to the vein,
so to say...

MsgJp:
激しい魔力の本流を感じ、魔法陣を練って
解き放つの――！
その快感、あなたも味わってみない？
MsgEn:
Feel the intense flow of magickal power, weave
the spell, and unleash it—!
Wouldn't you like a taste of that?

MsgJp:
あたくしの出す試練を見事こなせたら
《ソーサラー》への入門を認めてあげるわよ
MsgEn:
If you can successfully overcome the trials I
present to you, I shall grant you entry into the
world of the Sorcerer.

MsgJp:
魔術師のこと、知りたいの？
あたくし達《ソーサラー》はスペルと理律
によって万物を理解し紡ぎ、精錬するの――
MsgEn:
Curious about Sorcerers?
We, the Sorcerers, comprehend and weave the
fabric of existence through spells and principles,
refining it to our will.

MsgJp:
神官の術とは全く異なるものなのよ
簡単に言うと、学問に近い術体系かも
しれないわね
MsgEn:
It's very different from the priestly arts.
Simply put, it's a system that may be closer to
academia.

MsgJp:
世界を包むさまざまな力の法則を知り
紡ぎ、操る技なの
そしてその力は、生死や世界そのものの
成り立ちに深く繋がっているわ
MsgEn:
It's about knowing, weaving, and manipulating the
laws of various powers that envelop the world.
And that power is deeply connected to the very
foundation of life, death, and existence itself.

MsgJp:
魔術の多くが破壊の力として顕れるのは
そのせいかしらね？　ふふふ
MsgEn:
I wonder if the destructive nature of many a
spell stems from the same underlying principles?
Hehehe.

MsgJp:
どう？
少しは興味を持ってもらえたかしら
あなたに相応の実力と信頼があれば――
もっと深く教えてあげるわ
MsgEn:
How about it?
I wonder if I've managed to pique your interest a
little.
If you have the appropriate skills and trust—
I will teach you more in depth.

MsgJp:
ソーサラーにとって、《スペリング》の
習熟が一つの大きなポイントね
MsgEn:
For a Sorcerer, mastery of "Chanting" is a major
point.

MsgJp:
同じ魔法でも、詠唱中に魔力を練る人と
そのまま詠唱する人では
実戦での威力はかなり変わってくる
MsgEn:
Even with the same magick, the difference in the
power during combat can vary greatly between those
who refine their magick while chanting and those
who simply chant it as is.

MsgJp:
才能もあるかもしれないけれど
スペリングは基本、努力と練習で
身に付けるものなの
MsgEn:
There may also be talent involved, but chanting
is fundamentally something that can be acquired
through effort and practice.

MsgJp: ふふふ、練習を怠ってはダメよ
MsgEn: Hehehe, don't be lazy in practicing.

MsgJp:
ふふふ
あなたの素養、確認させてもらったわ
合格よ
MsgEn:
Hehehe.
I have confirmed your aptitude.
You have passed.

MsgJp:
ようこそ、魔術の世界へ！
新しき《ソーサラー》として
あなたを歓迎するわ
MsgEn:
Welcome to the world of Sorcery!
Allow me to extend a warm welcome to you,
neophyte Sorcerer.

MsgJp:
でもまだ魔の扉は開かれたばかり
あなたがこの先、魔術をどれほど識り
求め、体得できるかどうかは修練次第よ
MsgEn:
Yet, the door to Sorcery has just been unlocked.
Just how far you can delve into the depths of
magic, just how much you can grasp and master,
lies solely in your dedication to your practice.

MsgJp:
その師として魔女の血脈である
あたくしが、直々に導いてあげるわ
MsgEn:
With Witch blood flowing freely through my veins,
I will personally guide you.

MsgJp: ふふふ――感謝しなさい
MsgEn: Hehehe... Be grateful.

MsgJp:
あなた、魔術師としてそこそこ腕を
上げてきたようね
そろそろ頃合いかしら
MsgEn:
You've become quite skilled as a sorcerer,
haven't you?
I suppose it's about time.

MsgJp:
さらに一歩
魔の深淵に近づく術を授けてあげる
さぁ、すぐにスペリングの修行を始めなさいな
MsgEn:
I will give you a technique to peer into the
abyss of magic even further.
Now, start practicing your spell immediately.

MsgJp:
あぁ、あなたがここまでの域に
到達するなんて、あたくしも嬉しいわ
MsgEn: Ah, I'm so glad that you've reached this level.

MsgJp:
魔術の極意、あなたに授けてあげましょう
《ソーサラー》の魔術とは、己の身を
世界にあまねく大いなる力と一体化させる術
MsgEn:
Let me bestow upon you the essence of sorcery.
The magic of the "Sorcerer" is the art of
integrating oneself with the vast power of the
world.

MsgJp:
人であることを忘れ、力に身を委ねなさい
そして、深淵に踏み込みなさい――
ふふふ
MsgEn:
Forget that you are human, surrender yourself to
power, and step into the abyss--
Hehehe

MsgJp:
あらぁ、パトリシアからの紹介があった人じゃない
魔の深淵へ近づく覚悟を決めたのね
MsgEn:
Oh, you're the one Patricia referred, aren't you?
You've decided to approach the abyss of magic.

MsgJp:
いいわ、まずは改めて自己紹介といこうかしら
あたくしはエメラダ、《ソーサラー》よ
大きすぎる破壊の力ゆえ
今は神殿で禁じられた術――魔術を伝えているの
MsgEn:
Okay, first of all, let me introduce myself again:
I am Emerada, a "Sorcerer."
The Temple has deemed Sorcery too dangerous,
banishing it from their teachings.
Yet, I continue to instruct those who seek to
harness its power.

MsgJp:
世界を包む霊、質、量、法則を知り
望む力を生みだす技、その根源は
生死や世界そのものの成り立ちにまで
深く繋がっているわ
MsgEn:
Knowledge in the spirits, essences, quantities,
and laws that envelop the world, the technique
that produces the power you seek is deeply
connected to the very foundation of life, death,
and the origins of existence itself.

MsgJp:
ふふ、もしかしたら神殿が禁じたのは
そういう所が、例のあの学問と似ているから――
かもしれないわね
MsgEn:
Hehe, perhaps the reason the temple forbade it is
because such knowledge cuts too close to the vein,
so to say...

MsgJp:
――見たところ、あなたはまだ
魔の扉を開いたばかりのようね
あなたがこの先、魔術をどれほど識り
求め、体得できるかどうかは修練次第よ
MsgEn:
--It seems that you have just opened the door to
the realm of sorcery, haven't you?
Just how much you can understand and master magic
in the future depends on your dedication.

MsgJp:
その師として魔女の血脈である
あたくしが、直々に導いてあげるわ
MsgEn:
With Witch blood flowing freely through my veins,
I will personally guide you.

MsgJp:
たくさん課題を出して、磨いて――
もっとずっと強くて魅力的な
《ソーサラー》に仕上げてあげる
MsgEn:
I'll give you plenty of tasks to hone your
skills--
and turn you into a much stronger and more
captivating "Sorcerer."

MsgJp: ふふふ――感謝しなさい
MsgEn: Hehehe... Be grateful.

MsgJp:
《ソーサラー》として
あなたはまだ可愛いヒナ鳥――
MsgEn:
As a "Sorcerer," you're just a cute little baby
bird.

MsgJp:
せめて、基礎魔法程度は
自分の力で使えるようになりなさい
MsgEn: At least learn to use basic magic on your own.

MsgJp:
そうね
ジョブレベルが１８になって
せめて神殿の訓練官さんから巣立ち
の許可が貰えたなら――
MsgEn:
I see.
Once your job level reaches 18 and you at least
get permission to leave from the temple
instructor, then—

MsgJp:
もう少し大人の魔法を
教えてあげてもいいわ
MsgEn:
I wouldn't mind teaching you a bit more advanced
magic for adults.

MsgJp:
あら、あなた
ヒナ鳥から若鳥くらいまでには
成長しているじゃない
MsgEn:
My, a fledgling now, aren't you?
You've grown well.

MsgJp:
神殿の訓練官さんに、本格的に
魔術を習ってもいいかの確認は
してくるのよ
MsgEn:
You're going to check with the temple instructor
to see if you can start learning sorcery in
earnest.

MsgJp:
あたくしもパトリシアとの信頼もあるし
一応神殿の顔は立ててあげないとね
MsgEn:
With my trust in Patricia and all, I should at
least maintain good standing with the temple.

MsgJp:
精神を集中し、狙い穿つ
元素と精の声に耳を傾けていれば
魔矢はおのずと的を射る
MsgEn:
Focus your mind and aim true.
Listen to the voices of elements and spirits, the
magick arrow will naturally hit its target.

MsgJp:
狩人の弓とは違う
エルフの弓は霊を放つ弓よ
MsgEn:
The Elven bow is different from the Hunter's bow.
The Elven bow is a bow that unleashes spirits.

MsgJp:
失われたエルフの民
その記憶と技術――
MsgEn:
The lost elven people, their memories and
techniques—

MsgJp:
私達兄妹は、それを残し
レスタニアに留めることを目指しているの
MsgEn:
My brother and I are determined to preserve this
history and ensure that these precious artifacts
remain within the borders of Lestania.

MsgJp:
この森を訪れた君が、その一役と
なってくれるなら、喜んで力を貸すわ
MsgEn:
If you, who have visited this forest, are willing
to lend a hand, I would gladly offer my
assistance.

MsgJp: 今日は少し森が騒がしいようね
MsgEn: Looks like the woods are a little noisy today.

MsgJp:
疲れてるんなら泊ってってもいいわよ
<VAL PRICE_INN>出してもらうけどいい？
あっ、足元見てるんじゃないよ
研究出費も馬鹿にならなくてね
MsgEn:
If you're tired, you can stay overnight.
Can I charge you <VAL PRICE_INN>?
Oh, I'm not just looking out for myself. Research
expenses are no joke, you know.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
でも君、《弱化》ではなさそうだね
心配しすぎなんじゃない？
MsgEn:
But you don't seem to be weakened, huh?
Aren't you worrying too much?

MsgJp:
ロンドジ―ルから君のことは聞いたわ
この森のこと、かなり詳しくなったみたいね
MsgEn:
I heard about you from Rondejeel.
Sounds like you've learned quite a bit about
these woods.

MsgJp:
紹介が遅れたけど、私はリングディール
この地で《エレメントアーチャー》
について研究しているの
どう？　君も学んでみない？
MsgEn:
Although I'm a bit late in introducing myself, I
am Ringdeel, a researcher studying the Element
Archer in this land.
What do you think? Would you like to learn as
well?

MsgJp:
《エレメントアーチャー》はもともと
エルフ族の技なの
私みたいに、修行を積めば
エルフじゃなくても使えるから心配しないで
MsgEn:
"Element Archer" is originally a technique of the
Elven race.
Even if you're not an elf, you can still use it
if you train like me, so don't worry.

MsgJp:
魔道弓と魔矢は、普通の弓矢とは違うわ
自身の生命力を力とし、放つ――
MsgEn:
The Magick Bow and bolts are different from
normal bows and arrows.
They harness one's own life force and fly forth—

MsgJp:
念じることで魔矢は、敵を穿つ刃にも
仲間を守る輝きにもなる
どれほど敵が多く、護るべき者がいようとも――
MsgEn:
By focusing your thoughts, magick arrows can
become blades that pierce through enemies, or
radiance that protects allies. No matter how many
enemies there are or how many you must protect—

MsgJp:
もしその気があるなら課題に挑戦してみて
君なら体得できるんじゃないかな
MsgEn:
If you're willing to put in the effort, why not
give the challenge a try?
I believe you have the potential to master it.

MsgJp: ふぅ――あら人間？
MsgEn: Phew... Oh, a human?

MsgJp:
私の弓はエルフの弓術師
《エレメントアーチャ―》のものよ
MsgEn:
My bow is that of an elven archer, an "Element
Archer" to be precise.

MsgJp:
魔道弓という特殊な弓で、鉄矢ではなく
霊的な魔矢を放つの
そして敵の身体ではなく、そうね
霊を捉えて狙いを定める――ってとこかしら
MsgEn:
Instead of iron arrows, this specialized bow,
known as the 'Magick Bow,' fires spiritual magick
arrows.
And instead of targeting the enemy's physical
body, it aims for their spirit.

MsgJp:
うーん、言葉で説明しにくいけれど
やってみれば自然に解ると思うわ
MsgEn:
Hmm, it's difficult to explain in words, but I
think you'll understand naturally once you try it.

MsgJp:
あと、魔矢で射るのは敵だけじゃないのよ
霊的な矢だからね。味方を思う念を込めれば
活力を上げてあげることもできるわ
MsgEn:
Oh, and the magic arrows aren't just for
attacking enemies.
Since they're spiritual arrows, you can imbue
them with thoughts of healing and support to
revitalize your allies.

MsgJp:
精と霊による攻撃と支援
誇り高いエルフが残した弓術
君にも、もっと知ってほしいわ
MsgEn:
Attacks and support using spirit and soul, proud
archery techniques left behind by the noble elves.
I want you to know more about them.

MsgJp: 君がこの森のため、力を貸してくれるならね
MsgEn:
Only if you are willing to help us for the sake
of this forest.

MsgJp:
君、だいぶこの森に慣れてきたみたいね
課題は合格よ
そろそろ君にもエルフの弓――
魔道弓を持ってもらおうかな
MsgEn:
You seem to have gotten quite accustomed to this
forest.
You've passed the challenge.
I think it's time for you to have an elven bow――
a magick bow.

MsgJp:
エルフの弓師は《エレメントアーチャ―》
と呼ばれていたの
生命力を矢として放つ
ハンターのとは異なる弓術よ
MsgEn:
Elven archers were known as 'Element Archers.'
Their archery differed from that of hunters, as
they fired life force as their arrows.

MsgJp:
君が私と一緒に、エレメントアーチャ―として
エルフが遺した神秘の技を探求して
くれるなら、私も心強いわ
MsgEn:
If you join me as an Elemental Archer, and seek
out the mysterious techniques left behind by the
elves, I'll feel much more confident.

MsgJp: 彼らの技、私達で取り戻しましょう
MsgEn: Let's reclaim their techniques together.

MsgJp:
《エレメントアーチャ―》の魔矢はね
狙いを定めて、より長く獲物を見据えるほどに
強さが増すの
MsgEn:
The magick arrows of the Elemental Archer, you
see, grow stronger the longer you aim and focus on
your prey.

MsgJp:
《魔眼の集中》――私は、そう呼んでいるの
集中力が矢の霊的強度に比例するみたい
MsgEn:
I call it "Concentration of the Magick Eye."
It seems that the intensity of the arrow's
spiritual strength is proportional to the
concentration.

MsgJp:
魔矢の調子はどう？
聞くまでもなく、上達してるようね
MsgEn:
How are your magick arrows performing?
It's apparent that you've elevated your archery
prowess.

MsgJp:
そうだ、少し前、新しい技を発見したの
ちょっと難しいから置いてたんだけど
今なら君にもできると思うわよ
試してみて
MsgEn:
Indeed, I recently discovered a new technique.
I've been putting it aside since it's a bit
tricky, but I believe you're ready for it now.
Give it a try.

MsgJp:
うん、さすがね！
目で見て解るくらい君の霊力
強くなってるわ
MsgEn:
Hmm, as expected!
Your spiritual power has definitely grown
stronger, to the point where I can see it with my
own eyes.

MsgJp:
エルフの中でも一握りの者しか
扱えなかったという、《エレメントアーチャ―》
の極意――
MsgEn:
Among the elves, only a handful of individuals
were able to wield the secret techniques of the
"Element Archer."

MsgJp:
私もまだ安定して扱えないんだけど
君ならできるかも
この技、試してみない？
先を越されるのは悔しいけど
MsgEn:
I'm still working on perfecting my own execution,
but I'm confident you could pull it off.
Care to give this technique a try?
It would be a shame to be outdone, though.

MsgJp:
ロンドジールから君のことは聞いたわ
魔道弓のことを詳しく学びたいんだってね
MsgEn:
I heard about you from Rondejeel.
You said you wanted to learn more about the
Magick Bow, right?

MsgJp:
紹介が遅れたけど、私はリングディール
この地で《エレメントアーチャー》
について研究しているの
MsgEn:
Although I'm a bit late in introducing myself, I
am Ringdeel, a researcher studying the Element
Archer in this land.
What do you think? Would you like to learn as
well?

MsgJp:
《エレメントアーチャー》はもともと
エルフ族の技なの
君や私みたいに、素質のある人が修行を積めば
エルフじゃなくても使えるんだけどね
MsgEn:
"Element Archery" was originally an elven
technique.
With training and the right aptitude, individuals
like you and me can wield it, even if we're not
elves.

MsgJp:
魔道弓と魔矢は、普通の弓矢とは違うわ
自身の生命力を力とし、放つ――
MsgEn:
The Magick Bow and bolts are different from
normal bows and arrows.
They harness one's own life force and fly forth—

MsgJp:
念じることで魔矢は、敵を穿つ刃にも
仲間を守る輝きにもなる
どれほど敵が多く、護るべき者がいようとも――
MsgEn:
By focusing your thoughts, magick arrows can
become blades that pierce through enemies, or
radiance that protects allies. No matter how many
enemies there are or how many you must protect—

MsgJp:
君が私と一緒に、エレメントアーチャーとして
エルフが遺した神秘の技を探求して
くれるなら、私も心強いわ
MsgEn:
If you join me as an Element Archer, and seek out
the mysterious techniques left behind by the
elves, I'll feel much more confident.

MsgJp:
練習や課題はあるけど――
これから一緒にがんばっていこうね
MsgEn:
There may be practice and assignments, but...
let's do our best together from now on, okay?

MsgJp:
どう？　魔道弓の調子は
最初は自分でさぐりつつ
手になじむまで試してみてね
MsgEn:
How's the Magick Bow feeling?
At first, experiment on your own a bit and try it
out until you get used to it.

MsgJp:
《エレメントアーチャ―》として
ジョブレベルが１８になったらさ
難しい技にも挑戦したらいいよ
MsgEn:
Once you reach Job Level 18 as an Element Archer,
you should start trying out more challenging
techniques.

MsgJp:
でも君は覚者だし、神殿の訓練官にも
エレメントアーチャ―としてより難しい
戦技を学ぶなら、私からになるっていう
確認はとっておいてね
MsgEn:
But you're the Arisen, and you train at the
temple.
As an elemental archer, it's more difficult.
If you want to learn the more difficult skills,
you'll have to start with me.
Just make sure you get confirmation first.

MsgJp: その時がきたら、一緒にがんばりましょう
MsgEn: When the time comes, let's do our best together.

MsgJp:
あ、泊ってく？
森の探索って大変だし、休みたい時は
いつでも言ってね
MsgEn:
Ah, do you want to stay overnight?
Exploring the forest is tough, so whenever you
want to take a break, just let me know.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》？　多分できると思うけど
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>くらいは出してもらう
ことになるわ、それでもいい？
MsgEn:
"Treat Weakness?"
I think I can probably do it, but I'll have to
get <VAL PRICE_WEAK> or so out of you.
Is that okay with you?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
もうかなり魔道弓が馴染んで
きたんじゃない？
さまになってきてるわ
MsgEn:
I think you're getting pretty comfortable with
your Magick Bow by now.
It's starting to look natural on you.

MsgJp:
レベル的には私と一緒に難度の高い術を
練習していけそうだけど
君は覚者だしね
MsgEn:
In terms of level, it seems like we can practice
difficult techniques together.
You are an Arisen, after all.

MsgJp:
一応、その前に神殿の訓練官には
話を通しておいてね
それから本格的にエルフの戦闘術を
磨いていきましょう
MsgEn:
For now, please inform the temple trainer
beforehand.
Then, let's polish our elven combat techniques in
earnest.

MsgJp: 何だ、何か欲しい物あるか
MsgEn: What, need something?

MsgJp: 筋ある奴、弓教える悪くない
MsgEn: You look strong, I teach you archery.

MsgJp:
ここ獲物多い
大物狙い、森の奥
MsgEn:
Lots of prey here.
Big game, deep in the woods.

MsgJp:
――あぁ、ん――？
お前、まだ未熟
《ハンター》として半人前
MsgEn:
Ahh, hm...?
You, not ready.
Only half-baked "Hunter".

MsgJp:
《ハンター》、弓を使う
敵の弱点――空の敵――
MsgEn:
"Hunters" use bows.
Hit weak point -- flying enemies --

MsgJp:
だが、それだけ違う
弓と矢の使い方
MsgEn: That's not all ways to use bow and arrow.

MsgJp:
撃ち方、狙う距離、矢の種類――
射る、奥深い
MsgEn:
How to shoot, target distance, types of arrows--
Lots to archery.

MsgJp:
お前、《ハンター》見込みある
わざ、磨くか？
MsgEn:
You, do you have potential as a Hunter?
Come polish your skills?

MsgJp:
オレ、イヴァン、教えてやる
それでお前の矢、もっと強くなる
MsgEn:
I, Ivan, teach you well.
Your arrows will grow stronger.

MsgJp:
イニアス湖、この湖
知ってるか
MsgEn: Lake Inias, do you know about this lake?

MsgJp:
生き物たくさんいる
特に多い、ブルーニュート
MsgEn:
Many critters.
Especially Blue Newts.

MsgJp:
たまに手強い群、出てくることある
お前、気をつけろ
MsgEn:
Sometimes tough groups emerge.
You, be careful.

MsgJp:
湖の北、危ない
密猟者多い
気味悪い廃墟ある
MsgEn:
North of the lake, dangerous.
Many poachers.
Many eerie ruins.

MsgJp: オレ、あのあたり行かない
MsgEn: I don't go to that area.

MsgJp:
森の南、大物多い
遺跡に白獅子出たことある
かなりの強敵
MsgEn:
South of the forest, a lot of big game.
I've seen a white lion in the ruins, strong enemy.

MsgJp:
巨人も出たことある
相当の乱暴者
MsgEn: There are giants, incredibly violent.

MsgJp:
もし現れたら、戦うか逃げるか
迷わず決めろ
判断遅れ、命取り
MsgEn:
If you see them, fight or flee at once.
Waiting can kill you.

MsgJp: ――ん？　あぁ
MsgEn: ... Hm? Ah.

MsgJp: お前、筋良い
MsgEn: You have good instincts.

MsgJp: 大丈夫、もう立派な《ハンター》
MsgEn: Don't worry, you are already a fine Hunter.

MsgJp:
お前、まだ未熟
弓の使い方、もっと覚えろ
MsgEn:
You, still green.
Learn the proper way to use a bow.

MsgJp:
それでお前の弓
ずっと鋭く速くなる
MsgEn:
With that, your bow will become sharp and swift,
forever.

MsgJp:
お前、もう弓、身体の一部
十分解ってる、弓のこと
MsgEn:
You and your bow are already one;
you understand the bow thoroughly.

MsgJp:
だから、教えてやる
オレの十八番
MsgEn: So, I'll teach you my specialty.

MsgJp: 《ハンター》、弓うつ、獲物狙う
MsgEn: The Hunter, bow drawn, aims at their prey.

MsgJp: 剣届かないやつ、弓届く
MsgEn:
The one who can't reach with a sword, can reach
with a bow.

MsgJp:
矢、いくつか種類ある
知ってるか？
MsgEn:
Arrows, there are several types.
Know about them?

MsgJp:
固い大物狙う、矢じりに爆薬仕込む
威力強くなる
MsgEn:
When aiming for sturdy large prey, put explosives
on arrow to make it more powerful.

MsgJp:
他にも毒や睡眠薬、塗った矢もある
お前、選んで使え
MsgEn:
There are also poison and sleep-inducing arrows,
and more.
You, choose and use them as you see fit.

MsgJp:
お前、まだまだ
弓、練習もっとしろ
MsgEn:
You, still a long way to go.
Practice the bow more.

MsgJp:
《ハンター》続ける
ジョブレベル１８なる――
MsgEn:
Continue as a "Hunter."
Reach job level 18—

MsgJp:
神殿の訓練官、お前の腕認めれば
オレに紹介くる
MsgEn:
If the temple instructor recognizes your skill,
he will introduce you.

MsgJp:
それから教えてやる
もっと強い、速い弓
MsgEn:
Then I will teach you.
Stronger, faster bow.

MsgJp:
お前、レベルいい線きた
もっと強い弓そろそろ教えてやる
MsgEn:
You, you're getting pretty good.
I'll teach you a stronger bow soon.

MsgJp:
だけど、義理大事
お前見てきた神殿の訓練官に
挨拶してこい
MsgEn:
But, duty is important.
Go greet the temple instructor.

MsgJp: オレ教える、その後
MsgEn: After that, I teach you.

MsgJp:
長くザンドラに滞在し見聞を深めるも
未だ知れぬこと多し
MsgEn:
Even after spending a long time in Zandora and
deepening my knowledge, there is still much I
don't know.

MsgJp:
ザンドラが禁域と呼ばれるは
白竜と神殿の意と伝え聞く
MsgEn:
I have heard that Zandora is called a forbidden
zone because of the White Dragon and the will of
the temple.

MsgJp:
封じられるべき禁術に人を寄せ付けんがため
しかし、封じられるものを開こうとするもまた
人と知の性
MsgEn:
Forbidden techniques are sealed away to prevent
people from using them.
Yet, the very nature of humanity and our thirst
for knowledge compels us to seek what's forbidden.

MsgJp:
不慣れであれば、標の祠に向かうのがよい
さすれば、この地の探索も思いのほか
捗ろう
MsgEn:
If you're not familiar with the area, heading
towards the shrine is a good idea to make better
progress in your exploration.

MsgJp: ほう、何を求めここへ来たるか
MsgEn: Oh, what brings you here?

MsgJp:
壁に梯子に岩山にサイクロプスに
まぁ、登るってもいろいろあるけどさ
MsgEn:
On the wall, on the ladder, on the rocky
mountain, and even the Cyclops...
Well, there are various ways to climb, you know.

MsgJp:
あんた、何に登りたいの？
俺はある程度なんでもイケるぜ
MsgEn:
What do you want to climb, my friend?
I can handle pretty much anything.

MsgJp:
高いとこ最高だよな！
そのうち、ボルド鉱山の山頂目指してやろうと
思ってんだよね
MsgEn:
Being up high is the best, isn't it?
I'm thinking of aiming for the summit of Volden
Mines someday.

MsgJp:
真面目に登ろうとするなら
ロープとダガ―は必須でしょ
MsgEn:
If you're serious about climbing, you'll need a
rope and a dagger.

MsgJp:
あんたもどう？
登りのノウハウ、教えてもいいぜ
MsgEn:
How about you?
I could teach you how to climb.

MsgJp:
へえ――
ヘイデンのおっさんに紹介されたのか
《シーカー》のこと知りたいってか？
もちろん、歓迎するぜ
MsgEn:
Heh--
You were introduced to me by old man Hayden?
You want to know about the "Seeker"?
Sure, you're welcome.

MsgJp:
そうだな、《シーカー》と言えばまずは
ダガ―を使った素早い連続攻撃――
それからロープを使った
立体移動が特徴だな
MsgEn:
